name: AccelerometerSensor
helpString:
Non-visible component that can detect shaking and measure acceleration approximately in three dimensions using SI units (m/s2). The components are:
  • xAccel: 0 when the phone is at rest on a flat surface, positive when the phone is tilted to the right (i.e., its left side is raised), and negative when the phone is tilted to the left (i.e., its right size is raised).
  • yAccel: 0 when the phone is at rest on a flat surface, positive when its bottom is raised, and negative when its top is raised.
  • zAccel: Equal to -9.8 (earth's gravity in meters per second per second when the device is at rest parallel to the ground with the display facing up, 0 when perpendicular to the ground, and +9.8 when facing down. The value can also be affected by accelerating it with or against gravity.

blockProperties.name: MinimumInterval
blockProperties.description: The minimum interval, in milliseconds, between phone shakes

blockProperties.name: Sensitivity
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how sensitive the accelerometer is. The choices are: 1 = weak, 2 = moderate,  3 = strong.

events.name: AccelerationChanged
events.description: Indicates the acceleration changed in the X, Y, and/or Z dimensions.

events.name: Shaking
events.description: Indicates the device started being shaken or continues to be shaken.

name: ActivityStarter
helpString:
A component that can launch an activity using the StartActivity method.

Activities that can be launched include:

  • starting other App Inventor for Android apps
  • starting the camera application
  • performing web search
  • opening a browser to a specified web page
  • opening the map application to a specified location
You can also launch activities that return text data. See the documentation on using the Activity Starter for examples.

blockProperties.name: ExtraKey
blockProperties.description:
Returns the extra key that will be passed to the activity.
DEPRECATED: New code should use Extras property instead.

blockProperties.name: ExtraValue
blockProperties.description:
Returns the extra value that will be passed to the activity.
DEPRECATED: New code should use Extras property instead.

events.name: ActivityCanceled
events.description: Event raised if this ActivityStarter returns because the activity was canceled.

events.name: ActivityError
events.description: The ActivityError event is no longer used. Please use the Screen.ErrorOccurred event instead.

events.name: AfterActivity
events.description: Event raised after this ActivityStarter returns.

methods.name: ResolveActivity
methods.description: Returns the name of the activity that corresponds to this ActivityStarter, or an empty string if no corresponding activity can be found.

methods.name: StartActivity
methods.description: Start the activity corresponding to this ActivityStarter.

name: Ball
helpString:
A round 'sprite' that can be placed on a Canvas, where it can react to touches and drags, interact with other sprites (ImageSprites and other Balls) and the edge of the Canvas, and move according to its property values.

For example, to have a Ball move 4 pixels toward the top of a Canvas every 500 milliseconds (half second), you would set the Speed property to 4 [pixels], the Interval property to 500 [milliseconds], the Heading property to 90 [degrees], and the Enabled property to True. These and its other properties can be changed at any time.

The difference between a Ball and an ImageSprite is that the latter can get its appearance from an image file, while a Ball's appearance can only be changed by varying its PaintColor and Radius properties.

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: Controls whether the sprite moves when its speed is non-zero.

blockProperties.name: Heading
blockProperties.description: Returns the sprite's heading in degrees above the positive x-axis.  Zero degrees is toward the right of the screen; 90 degrees is toward the top of the screen.

blockProperties.name: Interval
blockProperties.description: The interval in milliseconds at which the sprite's position is updated.  For example, if the interval is 50 and the speed is 10, then the sprite will move 10 pixels every 50 milliseconds.

blockProperties.name: Speed
blockProperties.description: he speed at which the sprite moves.  The sprite moves this many pixels every interval.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: True if the sprite is visible.

blockProperties.name: X
blockProperties.description: The horizontal coordinate of the left edge of the sprite, increasing as the sprite moves to the right.

blockProperties.name: Y
blockProperties.description: The vertical coordinate of the top of the sprite, increasing as the sprite moves down.

blockProperties.name: Z
blockProperties.description: How the sprite should be layered relative to other sprits, with higher-numbered layers in front of lower-numbered layers.

events.name: CollidedWith
events.description:
Handler for CollidedWith events, called when two sprites collide.
 Note that checking for collisions with a rotated ImageSprite currently
 checks against the sprite's unrotated position.  Therefore, collision
 checking will be inaccurate for tall narrow or short wide sprites that are
 rotated.

events.name: Dragged
events.description:
Handler for Dragged events.  On all calls, the starting coordinates
 are where the screen was first touched, and the "current" coordinates
 describe the endpoint of the current line segment.  On the first call
 within a given drag, the "previous" coordinates are the same as the
 starting coordinates; subsequently, they are the "current" coordinates
 from the prior call.  Note that the Sprite won't actually move
 anywhere in response to the Dragged event unless MoveTo is
 specifically called.

events.name: EdgeReached
events.description: Event handler called when the sprite reaches an edge of the screen. If Bounce is then called with that edge, the sprite will appear to bounce off of the edge it reached.  Edge here is represented as an integer that indicates one of eight directions north(1), northeast(2), east(3), southeast(4), south (-1), southwest(-2), west(-3), and northwest(-4).

events.name: Flung
events.description:
When a fling gesture (quick swipe) is made on the sprite: provides
 the (x,y) position of the start of the fling, relative to the upper
 left of the canvas. Also provides the speed (pixels per millisecond) and heading
 (0-360 degrees) of the fling, as well as the x velocity and y velocity
 components of the fling's vector.

events.name: NoLongerCollidingWith
events.description: Event indicating that a pair of sprites are no longer colliding.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description:
When the user begins touching the sprite (places finger on sprite and
 leaves it there): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative
 to the upper left of the canvas

events.name: TouchUp
events.description:
When the user stops touching the sprite (lifts finger after a
 TouchDown event): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative
 to the upper left of the canvas

events.name: Touched
events.description:
When the user touches the sprite and then immediately lifts finger: provides
 the (x,y) position of the touch, relative to the upper left of the canvas

methods.name: Bounce
methods.description: Makes this sprite bounce, as if off a wall.  For normal bouncing, the edge argument should be the one returned by EdgeReached.

methods.name: CollidingWith
methods.description:
Indicates whether a collision has been registered between this sprite
 and the passed sprite.

methods.name: MoveIntoBounds
methods.description:
Moves the sprite back in bounds if part of it extends out of bounds,
 having no effect otherwise. If the sprite is too wide to fit on the
 canvas, this aligns the left side of the sprite with the left side of the
 canvas. If the sprite is too tall to fit on the canvas, this aligns the
 top side of the sprite with the top side of the canvas.

methods.name: MoveTo
methods.description: Moves the sprite so that its left top corner is at the specfied x and y coordinates.

methods.name: PointInDirection
methods.description: Turns the sprite to point towards the point with coordinates as (x, y).

methods.name: PointTowards
methods.description: Turns the sprite to point towards a designated target sprite. The new heading will be parallel to the line joining the centerpoints of the two sprites.

name: BarcodeScanner
helpString: Component for using the Barcode Scanner to read a barcode

blockProperties.name: Result
blockProperties.description: Text result of the previous scan.

blockProperties.name: UseExternalScanner
blockProperties.description: If true App Inventor will look for and use an external scanning program such as "Bar Code Scanner."

events.name: AfterScan
events.description: Indicates that the scanner has read a (text) result and provides the result

methods.name: DoScan
methods.description: Begins a barcode scan, using the camera. When the scan is complete, the AfterScan event will be raised.

methods.name: Send2ByteNumber
methods.description: Send a 2-byte number to the connected Bluetooth device.

methods.name: Send4ByteNumber

methods.name: SendBytes

name: Button
helpString: Button with the ability to detect clicks. Many aspects of its appearance can be changed, as well as whether it is clickable (Enabled), can be changed in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: Point size for button text.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: Font family for button text.

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Image to display on button.

blockProperties.name: Shape
blockProperties.description: Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed.

blockProperties.name: ShowFeedback
blockProperties.description: Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown  for a button that as an image as background.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: Text to display on button.

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Left, center, or right.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Color for button text.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: Click
events.description: User tapped and released the button.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

events.name: LongClick
events.description: User held the button down.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description: Indicates that the button was pressed down.

events.name: TouchUp
events.description: Indicates that a button has been released.

name: Camcorder
helpString: A component to record a video using the device's camcorder.After the video is recorded, the name of the file on the phone containing the clip is available as an argument to the AfterRecording event. The file name can be used, for example, to set the source property of a VideoPlayer component.

events.name: AfterRecording
events.description:
Indicates that a video was recorded with the camera and provides the path to
 the stored picture.

methods.name: RecordVideo
methods.description: Records a video, then raises the AfterRecoding event.

name: Camera
helpString: A component to take a picture using the device's camera. After the picture is taken, the name of the file on the phone containing the picture is available as an argument to the AfterPicture event. The file name can be used, for example, to set the Picture property of an Image component.

blockProperties.name: UseFront
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the front-facing camera should be used (when available). If the device does not have a front-facing camera, this option will be ignored and the camera will open normally.

events.name: AfterPicture
events.description:
Indicates that a photo was taken with the camera and provides the path to
 the stored picture.

methods.name: TakePicture
methods.description:
Takes a picture, then raises the AfterPicture event.
 If useFront is true, adds an extra to the intent that requests the front-facing camera.

name: Canvas
helpString:
A two-dimensional touch-sensitive rectangular panel on which drawing can be done and sprites can be moved.

The BackgroundColor, PaintColor, BackgroundImage, Width, and Height of the Canvas can be set in either the Designer or in the Blocks Editor. The Width and Height are measured in pixels and must be positive.

Any location on the Canvas can be specified as a pair of (X, Y) values, where

  • X is the number of pixels away from the left edge of the Canvas
  • Y is the number of pixels away from the top edge of the Canvas
.

There are events to tell when and where a Canvas has been touched or a Sprite (ImageSprite or Ball) has been dragged. There are also methods for drawing points, lines, and circles.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: The color of the canvas background.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundImage
blockProperties.description: The name of a file containing the background image for the canvas

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: The font size of text drawn on the canvas.

blockProperties.name: LineWidth
blockProperties.description: The width of lines drawn on the canvas.

blockProperties.name: PaintColor
blockProperties.description: The color in which lines are drawn

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Determines the alignment of the text drawn by DrawText() or DrawAngle() with respect to the point specified by that command: point at the left of the text, point at the center of the text, or point at the right of the text.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: Dragged
events.description:
When the user does a drag from one point (prevX, prevY) to
 another (x, y).  The pair (startX, startY) indicates where the
 user first touched the screen, and "draggedAnySprite" indicates whether a
 sprite is being dragged.

events.name: Flung
events.description:
When a fling gesture (quick swipe) is made on the canvas: provides
 the (x,y) position of the start of the fling, relative to the upper
 left of the canvas. Also provides the speed (pixels per millisecond) and heading
 (0-360 degrees) of the fling, as well as the x velocity and y velocity
 components of the fling's vector. The value "flungSprite" is true if a sprite
 was located near the the starting point of the fling gesture.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description:
When the user begins touching the canvas (places finger on canvas and
 leaves it there): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative
 to the upper left of the canvas

events.name: TouchUp
events.description:
When the user stops touching the canvas (lifts finger after a
 TouchDown event): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative
 to the upper left of the canvas

events.name: Touched
events.description:
When the user touches the canvas and then immediately lifts finger: provides
 the (x,y) position of the touch, relative to the upper left of the canvas.  TouchedAnySprite
 is true if the same touch also touched a sprite, and false otherwise.

methods.name: Clear
methods.description: Clears anything drawn on this Canvas but not any background color or image.

methods.name: DrawCircle
methods.description: Draws a circle (filled in) with the given radius centered at the given coordinates on the canvas

methods.name: DrawLine
methods.description: Draws a line between the given coordinates on the canvas.

methods.name: DrawPoint
methods.description: Draws a point at the given coordinates on the canvas.

methods.name: DrawText
methods.description: Draws the specified text relative to the specified coordinates using the values of the FontSize and TextAlignment properties.

methods.name: DrawTextAtAngle
methods.description: Draws the specified text starting at the specified coordinates at the specified angle using the values of the FontSize and TextAlignment properties.

methods.name: GetBackgroundPixelColor
methods.description: Gets the color of the specified point. This includes the background and any drawn points, lines, or circles but not sprites.

methods.name: GetPixelColor
methods.description: Gets the color of the specified point.

methods.name: Save
methods.description: Saves a picture of this Canvas to the device's external storage. If an error occurs, the Screen's ErrorOccurred event will be called.

methods.name: SaveAs
methods.description: Saves a picture of this Canvas to the device's external storage in the file named fileName. fileName must end with one of .jpg, .jpeg, or .png, which determines the file type.

methods.name: SetBackgroundPixelColor
methods.description: Sets the color of the specified point. This differs from DrawPoint by having an argument for color.

name: CheckBox
helpString: Checkbox that raises an event when the user clicks on it. There are many properties affecting its appearance that can be set in the Designer or Blocks Editor.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: Changed
events.description: Default Changed event handler.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Default GotFocus event handler.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Default LostFocus event handler.

name: Clock
helpString:
Non-visible component that provides the instant in time using the internal clock on the phone. It can fire a timer at regularly set intervals and perform time calculations, manipulations, and conversions.

Methods to convert an instant to text are also available. Acceptable patterns are empty string, MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm:ss a, or MMM d, yyyyHH:mm. The empty string will provide the default format, which is "MMM d, yyyy HH:mm:ss a" for FormatDateTime "MMM d, yyyy" for FormatDate. To see all possible format, please see here.

blockProperties.name: TimerAlwaysFires
blockProperties.description: Will fire even when application is not showing on the screen if true

blockProperties.name: TimerEnabled
blockProperties.description: Fires timer if true

blockProperties.name: TimerInterval
blockProperties.description: Interval between timer events in ms

events.name: Timer
events.description: Timer has gone off.

methods.name: AddDays
methods.description: An instant in time some days after the argument

methods.name: AddDuration
methods.description: An instant in time some duration after the argument

methods.name: AddHours
methods.description: An instant in time some hours after the argument

methods.name: AddMinutes
methods.description: An instant in time some minutes after the argument

methods.name: AddMonths
methods.description: An instant in time some months after the argument

methods.name: AddSeconds
methods.description: An instant in time some seconds after the argument

methods.name: AddWeeks
methods.description: An instant in time some weeks after the argument

methods.name: AddYears
methods.description: An instant in time some years after the argument

methods.name: DayOfMonth
methods.description: The day of the month

methods.name: Duration
methods.description: Milliseconds elapsed between instants

methods.name: DurationToDays
methods.description: convert duration to days

methods.name: DurationToHours
methods.description: convert duration to hours

methods.name: DurationToMinutes
methods.description: convert duration to minutes

methods.name: DurationToSeconds
methods.description: convert duration to seconds

methods.name: DurationToWeeks
methods.description: convert duration to weeks

methods.name: FormatDate
methods.description: Text representing the date of an instant in the specified pattern

methods.name: FormatDateTime
methods.description: Text representing the date and time of an instant in the specified pattern

methods.name: FormatTime
methods.description: Text representing the time of an instant

methods.name: GetMillis
methods.description: The instant in time measured as milliseconds since 1970.

methods.name: Hour
methods.description: The hour of the day

methods.name: MakeInstant
methods.description: An instant in time specified by MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss or MM/DD/YYYY or hh:mm

methods.name: MakeInstantFromMillis
methods.description: An instant in time specified by the milliseconds since 1970.

methods.name: Minute
methods.description: The minute of the hour

methods.name: Month
methods.description: The month of the year represented as a number from 1 to 12)

methods.name: MonthName
methods.description: The name of the month

methods.name: Now
methods.description: The current instant in time read from phone's clock

methods.name: Second
methods.description: The second of the minute

methods.name: SystemTime
methods.description: The phone's internal time

methods.name: Weekday
methods.description: The day of the week represented as a number from 1 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturday)

methods.name: WeekdayName
methods.description: The name of the day of the week

methods.name: Year
methods.description: The year

name: ContactPicker
helpString:
A button that, when clicked on, displays a list of the contacts to choose among. After the user has made a selection, the following properties will be set to information about the chosen contact:
  • ContactName: the contact's name
  • EmailAddress: the contact's primary email address
  • ContactUri: the contact's URI on the device
  • EmailAddressList: a list of the contact's email addresses
  • PhoneNumber: the contact's primary phone number (on Later Android Verisons)
  • PhoneNumberList: a list of the contact's phone numbers (on Later Android Versions)
  • Picture: the name of the file containing the contact's image, which can be used as a Picture property value for the Image or ImageSprite component.

Other properties affect the appearance of the button (TextAlignment, BackgroundColor, etc.) and whether it can be clicked on (Enabled).

The ContactPicker component might not work on all phones. For example, on Android systems before system 3.0, it cannot pick phone numbers, and the list of email addresses will contain only one email.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: ContactUri
blockProperties.description: URI that specifies the location of the contact on the device.

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: Point size for button text.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: Font family for button text.

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Image to display on button.

blockProperties.name: Shape
blockProperties.description: Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed.

blockProperties.name: ShowFeedback
blockProperties.description: Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown  for a button that as an image as background.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: Text to display on button.

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Left, center, or right.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Color for button text.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: AfterPicking
events.description:
Event to be raised after the picker activity returns its
 result and the properties have been filled in.

events.name: BeforePicking
events.description:
Event to raise when the button of the component is clicked or the list is shown
 using the Open block.  This event occurs before the list of items is displayed, and 
 can be used to prepare the list before it is shown.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description: Indicates that the button was pressed down.

events.name: TouchUp
events.description: Indicates that a button has been released.

methods.name: Open
methods.description: Opens the picker, as though the user clicked on it.

methods.name: ViewContact
methods.description: view a contact via its URI

name: DatePicker
helpString: A button that, when clicked on, launches a popup dialog to allow the user to select a date.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: Day
blockProperties.description: the Day of the month that was last picked using the DatePicker.

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize

Allows the user to set the date to be displayed when the date picker opens.
Valid values for the month field are 1-12 and 1-31 for the day field.

name: EmailPicker
helpString:
An EmailPicker is a kind of text box. If the user begins entering the name or email address of a contact, the phone will show a dropdown menu of choices that complete the entry. If there are many contacts, the dropdown can take several seconds to appear, and can show intermediate results while the matches are being computed.

The initial contents of the text box and the contents< after user entry is in the Text property. If the Text property is initially empty, the contents of the Hint property will be faintly shown in the text box as a hint to the user.

Other properties affect the appearance of the text box (TextAlignment, BackgroundColor, etc.) and whether it can be used (Enabled).

Text boxes like this are usually used with Button components, with the user clicking on the button when text entry is complete.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: The background color of the input box.  You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.  The default background color is 'default' (shaded 3-D look).

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the user can enter text into this input box.  By default, this is true.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: Whether the font for the text should be bold.  By default, it is not.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: Whether the text should appear in italics.  By default, it does not.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: The font size for the text.  By default, it is 14.0 points.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: The font for the text.  The value can be changed in the Designer.

blockProperties.name: Hint
blockProperties.description: Text that should appear faintly in the input box to provide a hint as to what the user should enter. This can only be seen if the Text property is empty.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: The text in the input box, which can be set by the programmer in the Designer or Blocks Editor, or it can be entered by the user (unless the Enabled property is false).

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Whether the text should be left justified, centered, or right justified.  By default, text is left justified.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: The color for the text.  You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.  The default text color is black.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description:
Event raised when this component is selected for input, such as by
 the user touching it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description:
Event raised when this component is no longer selected for input, such
 as if the user touches a different text box.

methods.name: RequestFocus
methods.description: Sets the textbox active.

blockProperties.name: BelowRangeEventEnabled

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient

events.name: BelowRange

methods.name: GetColorName

name: File
helpString: Non-visible component for storing and retrieving files. Use this component to write or read files on your device. The default behaviour is to write files to the private data directory associated with your App. The Companion is special cased to write files to /sdcard/AppInventor/data to facilitate debugging. If the file path starts with a slash (/), then the file is created relative to /sdcard. For example writing a file to /myFile.txt will write the file in /sdcard/myFile.txt.

events.name: AfterFileSaved
events.description: Event indicating that the contents of the file have been written.

events.name: GotText
events.description: Event indicating that the contents from the file have been read.

methods.name: AppendToFile
methods.description: Appends text to the end of a file storage, creating the file if it does not exist. See the help text under SaveFile for information about where files are written.

methods.name: Delete
methods.description: Deletes a file from storage. Prefix the filename with / to delete a specific file in the SD card, for instance /myFile.txt. will delete the file /sdcard/myFile.txt. If the file does not begin with a /, then the file located in the programs private storage will be deleted. Starting the file with // is an error because assets files cannot be deleted.

methods.name: ReadFrom
methods.description: Reads text from a file in storage. Prefix the filename with / to read from a specific file on the SD card. for instance /myFile.txt will read the file /sdcard/myFile.txt. To read assets packaged with an application (also works for the Companion) start the filename with // (two slashes). If a filename does not start with a slash, it will be read from the applications private storage (for packaged apps) and from /sdcard/AppInventor/data for the Companion.

methods.name: SaveFile
methods.description:
Saves text to a file. If the filename begins with a slash (/) the file is written to the sdcard. For example writing to /myFile.txt will write the file to /sdcard/myFile.txt. If the filename does not start with a slash, it will be written in the programs private data directory where it will not be accessible to other programs on the phone. There is a special exception for the AI Companion where these files are written to /sdcard/AppInventor/data to facilitate debugging. Note that this block will overwrite a file if it already exists.

If you want to add content to a file use the append block.

name: FirebaseDB
helpString: Non-visible component that communicates with a Firebase to store and retrieve information.

blockProperties.name: FirebaseURL
blockProperties.description: Gets the URL for this FirebaseDB.

blockProperties.name: Persist
blockProperties.description:
If true, variables will retain their values when off-line and the App exits. Values will be uploaded to Firebase the next time the App is run while connected to the network. This is useful for applications which will gather data while not connected to the network. Note: AppendValue and RemoveFirst will not work correctly when off-line, they require a network connection.

Note: If you set Persist on any Firebase component, on any screen, it makes all Firebase components on all screens persistent. This is a limitation of the low level Firebase library. Also be aware that if you want to set persist to true, you should do so before connecting the Companion for incremental development.

blockProperties.name: ProjectBucket
blockProperties.description: Gets the ProjectBucket for this FirebaseDB.

events.name: DataChanged
events.description:
Indicates that the data in the Firebase has changed.
 Launches an event with the tag and value that have been updated.

events.name: FirebaseError
events.description: Indicates that the communication with the Firebase signaled an error.

events.name: FirstRemoved
events.description: Event triggered by the "RemoveFirst" function. The argument "value" is the object that was the first in the list, and which is now removed.

events.name: GotValue
events.description: Indicates that a GetValue request has succeeded.

events.name: TagList
events.description: Event triggered when we have received the list of known tags. Used with the "GetTagList" Function.

methods.name: AppendValue
methods.description: Append a value to the end of a list atomically. If two devices use this function simultaneously, both will be appended and no data lost.

methods.name: ClearTag
methods.description: Remove the tag from Firebase

methods.name: GetTagList
methods.description: Get the list of tags for this application. When complete a "TagList" event will be triggered with the list of known tags.

methods.name: GetValue
methods.description:
GetValue asks Firebase to get the value stored under the given tag.
 It will pass valueIfTagNotThere to GotValue if there is no value stored
 under the tag.

methods.name: RemoveFirst
methods.description: Return the first element of a list and atomically remove it. If two devices use this function simultaneously, one will get the first element and the the other will get the second element, or an error if there is no available element. When the element is available, the "FirstRemoved" event will be triggered.

methods.name: StoreValue
methods.description: Asks Firebase to store the given value under the given tag.

methods.name: Unauthenticate
methods.description: If you are having difficulty with the Companion and you are switching between different Firebase accounts, you may need to use this function to clear internal Firebase caches. You can just use the "Do It" function on this block in the blocks editor. Note: You should not normally need to use this block as part of an application.

name: Form
helpString: Top-level component containing all other components in the program

blockProperties.name: AboutScreen

blockProperties.name: AlignHorizontal

blockProperties.name: AlignVertical
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Vertical alignment has no effect if the screen is scrollable.

blockProperties.name: AppName
blockProperties.description: This is the display name of the installed application in the phone.If the AppName is blank, it will be set to the name of the project when the project is built.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundImage

blockProperties.name: CloseScreenAnimation
blockProperties.description: The animation for closing current screen and returning  to the previous screen. Valid options are default, fade, zoom, slidehorizontal, slidevertical, and none

blockProperties.name: Height

blockProperties.name: OpenScreenAnimation
blockProperties.description: The animation for switching to another screen. Valid options are default, fade, zoom, slidehorizontal, slidevertical, and none

blockProperties.name: ScreenOrientation
blockProperties.description: The requested screen orientation, specified as a text value.  Commonly used values are landscape, portrait, sensor, user and unspecified.  See the Android developer documentation for ActivityInfo.Screen_Orientation for the complete list of possible settings.

blockProperties.name: Scrollable
blockProperties.description: When checked, there will be a vertical scrollbar on the screen, and the height of the application can exceed the physical height of the device. When unchecked, the application height is constrained to the height of the device.

blockProperties.name: ShowListsAsJson
blockProperties.description: If false, lists will be converted to strings using Lisp notation, i.e., as symbols separated by spaces, e.g., (a 1 b2 (c d). If true, lists will appear as in Json or Python, e.g.  ["a", 1, "b", 2, ["c", "d"]].  This property appears only in Screen 1, and the value for Screen 1 determines the behavior for all screens. The property defaults to "false" meaning that the App Inventor programmer must explicitly set it to "true" if JSON/Python syntax is desired. At some point in the future we will alter the system so that new projects are created with this property set to "true" by default. Existing projects will not be impacted. The App Inventor programmer can also set it back to "false" in newer projects if desired.

blockProperties.name: ShowStatusBar

blockProperties.name: Sizing

If set to responsive, screen layouts will use the actual resolution of the device.  See the documentation on responsive design in App Inventor for more information. This property appears on Screen1 only and controls the sizing for all screens in the app.

blockProperties.description: The caption for the form, which apears in the title bar

blockProperties.name: TitleVisible

events.name: Initialize

events.name: ScreenOrientationChanged

methods.name: HideKeyboard
