name: FusiontablesControl
helpString:
A non-visible component that communicates with Google Fusion Tables. Fusion Tables let you store, share, query and visualize data tables; this component lets you query, create, and modify these tables.

This component uses the Fusion Tables API V2.0.

Applications using Fusion Tables must authentication to Google's servers. There are two ways this can be done. The first way uses an API Key which you the developer obtain (see below). With this approach end-users must also login to access a Fusion Table. The second approach is to use a Service Account. With this approach you create credentials and a special "Service Account Email Address" which you obtain from the Google APIs Console. You then tell the Fusion Table Control the name of the Service Account Email address and upload the secret key as an asset to your application and set the KeyFile property to point at this file. Finally you check the "UseServiceAuthentication" checkbox in the designer. When using a Service Account, end-users do not need to login to use Fusion Tables, your service account authenticates all access.

To get an API key, follow these instructions.

  1. Go to your Google APIs Console and login if necessary.
  2. Select the Services item from the menu on the left.
  3. Choose the Fusiontables service from the list provided and turn it on.
  4. Go back to the main menu and select the API Access item.

Your API Key will be near the bottom of that pane in the section called "Simple API Access".You will have to provide that key as the value for the ApiKey property in your Fusiontables app.

Once you have an API key, set the value of the Query property to a valid Fusiontables SQL query and call SendQuery to execute the query. App Inventor will send the query to the Fusion Tables server and the GotResult block will fire when a result is returned from the server.Query results will be returned in CSV format, and can be converted to list format using the "list from csv table" or "list from csv row" blocks.

Note that you do not need to worry about UTF-encoding the query. But you do need to make sure the query follows the syntax described in the reference manual, which means that things like capitalization for names of columns matters, and that single quotes must be used around column names if there are spaces in them.

blockProperties.name: ApiKey
blockProperties.description: Your Google API Key. For help, click on the questionmark (?) next to the FusiontablesControl component in the Palette.

blockProperties.name: KeyFile
blockProperties.description: Specifies the path of the private key file.  This key file is used to get access to the FusionTables API.

blockProperties.name: Query
blockProperties.description:
The query to send to the Fusion Tables API.

For legal query formats and examples, see the Fusion Tables API v2.0 reference manual.

Note that you do not need to worry about UTF-encoding the query. But you do need to make sure it follows the syntax described in the reference manual, which means that things like capitalization for names of columns matters, and that single quotes need to be used around column names if there are spaces in them.

blockProperties.name: ServiceAccountEmail
blockProperties.description: The Service Account Email Address when service account authentication is in use.

blockProperties.name: UseServiceAuthentication
blockProperties.description: Indicates whether a service account should be used for authentication

events.name: GotResult
events.description: Indicates that the Fusion Tables query has finished processing, with a result.  The result of the query will generally be returned in CSV format, and can be converted to list format using the "list from csv table" or "list from csv row" blocks.

methods.name: DoQuery
methods.description: DEPRECATED. This block is deprecated as of the end of 2012.  Use SendQuery.

methods.name: ForgetLogin
methods.description: Forget end-users login credentials. Has no effect on service authentication

methods.name: GetRows
methods.description: Gets all the rows from a specified fusion table. The tableId field is the id of therequired fusion table. The columns field is a comma-separeted list of the columns to retrieve.

methods.name: GetRowsWithConditions
methods.description: Gets all the rows from a fusion table that meet certain conditions. The tableId field isthe id of the required fusion table. The columns field is a comma-separeted list of the columns toretrieve. The conditions field specifies what rows to retrieve from the table, for example the rows in whicha particular column value is not null.

methods.name: InsertRow
methods.description: Inserts a row into the specified fusion table. The tableId field is the id of thefusion table. The columns is a comma-separated list of the columns to insert values into. The values field specifies what values to insert into each column.

methods.name: SendQuery
methods.description: Send the query to the Fusiontables server.

name: GameClient
helpString: Provides a way for applications to communicate with online game servers

blockProperties.name: GameId
blockProperties.description: The game name for this application. The same game ID can have one or more game instances.

blockProperties.name: InstanceId
blockProperties.description: The game instance id.  Taken together,the game ID and the instance ID uniquely identify the game.

blockProperties.name: InvitedInstances
blockProperties.description: The set of game instances to which this player has been invited but has not yet joined.  To ensure current values are returned, first invoke GetInstanceLists.

blockProperties.name: JoinedInstances
blockProperties.description: The set of game instances in which this player is participating.  To ensure current values are returned, first invoke GetInstanceLists.

blockProperties.name: Leader
blockProperties.description: The game's leader. At any time, each game instance has only one leader, but the leader may change with time.  Initially, the leader is the game instance creator. Application writers determine special properties of the leader. The leader value is updated each time a successful communication is made with the server.

blockProperties.name: Players
blockProperties.description: The current set of players for this game instance. Each player is designated by an email address, which is a string. The list of players is updated each time a successful communication is made with the game server.

blockProperties.name: PublicInstances
blockProperties.description: The set of game instances that have been marked public. To ensure current values are returned, first invoke {@link #GetInstanceLists}.

blockProperties.name: ServiceUrl
blockProperties.description: The URL of the game server.

blockProperties.name: UserEmailAddress
blockProperties.description: The email address that is being used as the player id for this game client.   At present, users must set this manually in oder to join a game.  But this property will change in the future so that is set automatically, and users will not be able to change it.

events.name: FunctionCompleted
events.description: Indicates that a function call completed.

events.name: GotMessage
events.description: Indicates that a new message has been received.

events.name: Info
events.description: Indicates that something has occurred which the player should know about.

events.name: InstanceIdChanged
events.description: Indicates that the InstanceId property has changed as a result of calling MakeNewInstance or SetInstance.

events.name: Invited
events.description: Indicates that a user has been invited to this game instance.

events.name: NewInstanceMade
events.description: Indicates that a new instance was successfully created after calling MakeNewInstance.

events.name: NewLeader
events.description: Indicates that this game has a new leader as specified through SetLeader

events.name: PlayerJoined
events.description: Indicates that a new player has joined this game instance.

events.name: PlayerLeft
events.description: Indicates that a player has left this game instance.

events.name: ServerCommandFailure
events.description: Indicates that a server command failed.

events.name: ServerCommandSuccess
events.description: Indicates that a server command returned successfully.

events.name: UserEmailAddressSet
events.description: Indicates that the user email address has been set.

events.name: WebServiceError
events.description: Indicates that an error occurred while communicating with the web server.

methods.name: GetInstanceLists
methods.description: Updates the InstancesJoined and InstancesInvited lists. This procedure can be called before setting the InstanceId.

methods.name: GetMessages
methods.description: Retrieves messages of the specified type.

methods.name: Invite
methods.description: Invites a player to this game instance.

methods.name: LeaveInstance
methods.description: Leaves the current instance.

methods.name: MakeNewInstance
methods.description: Asks the server to create a new instance of this game.

methods.name: SendMessage
methods.description: Sends a keyed message to all recipients in the recipients list. The message will consist of the contents list.

methods.name: ServerCommand
methods.description: Sends the specified command to the game server.

methods.name: SetInstance
methods.description: Sets InstanceId and joins the specified instance.

methods.name: SetLeader
methods.description: Tells the server to set the leader to playerId. Only the current leader may successfully set a new leader.

name: GyroscopeSensor
helpString:
Non-visible component that can measure angular velocity in three dimensions in units of degrees per second.

In order to function, the component must have its Enabled property set to True, and the device must have a gyroscope sensor.

blockProperties.name: Available
blockProperties.description: Indicates whether a gyroscope sensor is available.

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If enabled, then sensor events will be generated and XAngularVelocity, YAngularVelocity, and ZAngularVelocity properties will have meaningful values.

blockProperties.name: XAngularVelocity
blockProperties.description: The angular velocity around the X axis, in degrees per second.

blockProperties.name: YAngularVelocity
blockProperties.description: The angular velocity around the Y axis, in degrees per second.

blockProperties.name: ZAngularVelocity
blockProperties.description: The angular velocity around the Z axis, in degrees per second.

events.name: GyroscopeChanged
events.description: Indicates that the gyroscope sensor data has changed. The timestamp parameter is the time in nanoseconds at which the event occurred.

name: HorizontalArrangement
helpString: A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed from left to right. If you wish to have components displayed one over another, use VerticalArrangement instead.

blockProperties.name: AlignHorizontal
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned  horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned,  3 = horizontally centered.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic.

blockProperties.name: AlignVertical
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned  vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the component's background color

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Specifies the path of the component's image.  If there is both an Image and a BackgroundColor, only the Image will be visible.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: HorizontalScrollArrangement
helpString:
A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed from left to right. If you wish to have components displayed one over another, use VerticalArrangement instead.

This version is scrollable.

blockProperties.name: AlignHorizontal
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned  horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned,  3 = horizontally centered.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic.

blockProperties.name: AlignVertical
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned  vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the component's background color

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Specifies the path of the component's image.  If there is both an Image and a BackgroundColor, only the Image will be visible.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: Image
helpString: Component for displaying images.  The picture to display, and other aspects of the Image's appearance, can be specified in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.

blockProperties.name: Animation
blockProperties.description: This is a limited form of animation that can attach a small number of motion types to images.  The allowable motions are ScrollRightSlow, ScrollRight, ScrollRightFast, ScrollLeftSlow, ScrollLeft, ScrollLeftFast, and Stop

blockProperties.name: RotationAngle
blockProperties.description: The angle at which the image picture appears rotated. This rotation does not appear on the designer screen, only on the device.

blockProperties.name: ScalePictureToFit
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the image should be resized to match the size of the ImageView.

blockProperties.name: Scaling
blockProperties.description: This property determines how the picture scales according to the Height or Width of the Image. Scale proportionally (0) preserves the picture aspect ratio. Scale to fit (1) matches the Image area, even if the aspect ratio changes.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: ImagePicker
helpString: A special-purpose button. When the user taps an image picker, the device's image gallery appears, and the user can choose an image. After an image is picked, it is saved, and the Selected property will be the name of the file where the image is stored. In order to not fill up storage, a maximum of 10 images will be stored. Picking more images will delete previous images, in order from oldest to newest.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: Point size for button text.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: Font family for button text.

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Image to display on button.

blockProperties.name: Selection
blockProperties.description: Path to the file containing the image that was selected.

blockProperties.name: Shape
blockProperties.description: Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed.

blockProperties.name: ShowFeedback
blockProperties.description: Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown  for a button that as an image as background.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: Text to display on button.

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Left, center, or right.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Color for button text.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: AfterPicking
events.description:
Event to be raised after the picker activity returns its
 result and the properties have been filled in.

events.name: BeforePicking
events.description:
Event to raise when the button of the component is clicked or the list is shown
 using the Open block.  This event occurs before the list of items is displayed, and 
 can be used to prepare the list before it is shown.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description: Indicates that the button was pressed down.

events.name: TouchUp
events.description: Indicates that a button has been released.

methods.name: Open
methods.description: Opens the picker, as though the user clicked on it.

name: ImageSprite
helpString:
A 'sprite' that can be placed on a Canvas, where it can react to touches and drags, interact with other sprites (Balls and other ImageSprites) and the edge of the Canvas, and move according to its property values. Its appearance is that of the image specified in its Picture property (unless its Visible property is False.

To have an ImageSprite move 10 pixels to the left every 1000 milliseconds (one second), for example, you would set the Speed property to 10 [pixels], the Interval property to 1000 [milliseconds], the Heading property to 180 [degrees], and the Enabled property to True. A sprite whose Rotates property is True will rotate its image as the sprite's Heading changes. Checking for collisions with a rotated sprite currently checks the sprite's unrotated position so that collision checking will be inaccurate for tall narrow or short wide sprites that are rotated. Any of the sprite properties can be changed at any time under program control.

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: Controls whether the sprite moves when its speed is non-zero.

blockProperties.name: Heading
blockProperties.description: Returns the sprite's heading in degrees above the positive x-axis.  Zero degrees is toward the right of the screen; 90 degrees is toward the top of the screen.

blockProperties.name: Interval
blockProperties.description: The interval in milliseconds at which the sprite's position is updated.  For example, if the interval is 50 and the speed is 10, then the sprite will move 10 pixels every 50 milliseconds.

blockProperties.name: Picture
blockProperties.description: The picture that determines the sprite's appearence

blockProperties.name: Rotates
blockProperties.description: If true, the sprite image rotates to match the sprite's heading. If false, the sprite image does not rotate when the sprite changes heading. The sprite rotates around its centerpoint.

blockProperties.name: Speed
blockProperties.description: he speed at which the sprite moves.  The sprite moves this many pixels every interval.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: True if the sprite is visible.

blockProperties.name: X
blockProperties.description: The horizontal coordinate of the left edge of the sprite, increasing as the sprite moves to the right.

blockProperties.name: Y
blockProperties.description: The vertical coordinate of the top of the sprite, increasing as the sprite moves down.

blockProperties.name: Z
blockProperties.description: How the sprite should be layered relative to other sprits, with higher-numbered layers in front of lower-numbered layers.

events.name: CollidedWith
events.description:
Handler for CollidedWith events, called when two sprites collide.
 Note that checking for collisions with a rotated ImageSprite currently
 checks against the sprite's unrotated position.  Therefore, collision
 checking will be inaccurate for tall narrow or short wide sprites that are
 rotated.

events.name: Dragged
events.description:
Handler for Dragged events.  On all calls, the starting coordinates
 are where the screen was first touched, and the "current" coordinates
 describe the endpoint of the current line segment.  On the first call
 within a given drag, the "previous" coordinates are the same as the
 starting coordinates; subsequently, they are the "current" coordinates
 from the prior call.  Note that the Sprite won't actually move
 anywhere in response to the Dragged event unless MoveTo is
 specifically called.

events.name: EdgeReached
events.description: Event handler called when the sprite reaches an edge of the screen. If Bounce is then called with that edge, the sprite will appear to bounce off of the edge it reached.  Edge here is represented as an integer that indicates one of eight directions north(1), northeast(2), east(3), southeast(4), south (-1), southwest(-2), west(-3), and northwest(-4).

events.name: Flung
events.description:
When a fling gesture (quick swipe) is made on the sprite: provides
 the (x,y) position of the start of the fling, relative to the upper
 left of the canvas. Also provides the speed (pixels per millisecond) and heading
 (0-360 degrees) of the fling, as well as the x velocity and y velocity
 components of the fling's vector.

events.name: NoLongerCollidingWith
events.description: Event indicating that a pair of sprites are no longer colliding.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description:
When the user begins touching the sprite (places finger on sprite and
 leaves it there): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative
 to the upper left of the canvas

events.name: TouchUp
events.description:
When the user stops touching the sprite (lifts finger after a
 TouchDown event): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative
 to the upper left of the canvas

events.name: Touched
events.description:
When the user touches the sprite and then immediately lifts finger: provides
 the (x,y) position of the touch, relative to the upper left of the canvas

methods.name: Bounce
methods.description: Makes this sprite bounce, as if off a wall.  For normal bouncing, the edge argument should be the one returned by EdgeReached.

methods.name: CollidingWith
methods.description:
Indicates whether a collision has been registered between this sprite
 and the passed sprite.

methods.name: MoveIntoBounds
methods.description:
Moves the sprite back in bounds if part of it extends out of bounds,
 having no effect otherwise. If the sprite is too wide to fit on the
 canvas, this aligns the left side of the sprite with the left side of the
 canvas. If the sprite is too tall to fit on the canvas, this aligns the
 top side of the sprite with the top side of the canvas.

methods.name: MoveTo
methods.description: Moves the sprite so that its left top corner is at the specfied x and y coordinates.

methods.name: PointInDirection
methods.description: Turns the sprite to point towards the point with coordinates as (x, y).

methods.name: PointTowards
methods.description: Turns the sprite to point towards a designated target sprite. The new heading will be parallel to the line joining the centerpoints of the two sprites.

name: Label
helpString: A Label displays a piece of text, which is specified through the Text property. Other properties, all of which can be set in the Designer or Blocks Editor, control the appearance and placement of the text.

blockProperties.name: HTMLFormat
blockProperties.description: If true, then this label will show html text else it will show plain text. Note: Not all HTML is supported.

blockProperties.name: HasMargins
blockProperties.description: Reports whether or not the label appears with margins.  All four margins (left, right, top, bottom) are the same.  This property has no effect in the designer, where labels are always shown with margins.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: ListPicker
helpString:
A button that, when clicked on, displays a list of texts for the user to choose among. The texts can be specified through the Designer or Blocks Editor by setting the ElementsFromString property to their string-separated concatenation (for example, choice 1, choice 2, choice 3) or by setting the Elements property to a List in the Blocks editor.

Setting property ShowFilterBar to true, will make the list searchable. Other properties affect the appearance of the button (TextAlignment, BackgroundColor, etc.) and whether it can be clicked on (Enabled).

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: Point size for button text.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: Font family for button text.

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Image to display on button.

blockProperties.name: ItemBackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: The background color of the ListPicker items.

blockProperties.name: ItemTextColor
blockProperties.description: The text color of the ListPicker items.

blockProperties.name: Selection
blockProperties.description: The selected item.  When directly changed by the programmer, the SelectionIndex property is also changed to the first item in the ListPicker with the given value.  If the value does not appear, SelectionIndex will be set to 0.

blockProperties.name: SelectionIndex
blockProperties.description: The index of the currently selected item, starting at 1.  If no item is selected, the value will be 0.  If an attempt is made to set this to a number less than 1 or greater than the number of items in the ListPicker, SelectionIndex will be set to 0, and Selection will be set to the empty text.

blockProperties.name: Shape
blockProperties.description: Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed.

blockProperties.name: ShowFeedback
blockProperties.description: Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown  for a button that as an image as background.

blockProperties.name: ShowFilterBar
blockProperties.description: Returns current state of ShowFilterBar indicating if Search Filter Bar will be displayed on ListPicker or not

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: Text to display on button.

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Left, center, or right.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Color for button text.

blockProperties.name: Title
blockProperties.description: Optional title displayed at the top of the list of choices.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: AfterPicking
events.description:
Event to be raised after the picker activity returns its
 result and the properties have been filled in.

events.name: BeforePicking
events.description:
Event to raise when the button of the component is clicked or the list is shown
 using the Open block.  This event occurs before the list of items is displayed, and 
 can be used to prepare the list before it is shown.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description: Indicates that the button was pressed down.

events.name: TouchUp
events.description: Indicates that a button has been released.

methods.name: Open
methods.description: Opens the picker, as though the user clicked on it.

name: ListView
helpString:
This is a visible component that displays a list of text elements.
The list can be set using the ElementsFromString property or using the Elements block in the blocks editor.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: The color of the listview background.

blockProperties.name: Elements
blockProperties.description: List of text elements to show in the ListView.  This willsignal an error if the elements are not text strings.

blockProperties.name: ElementsFromString
blockProperties.description: The TextView elements specified as a string with the items separated by commas such as: Cheese,Fruit,Bacon,Radish. Each word before the comma will be an element in the list.

blockProperties.name: Height
blockProperties.description: Determines the height of the list on the view.

blockProperties.name: Selection
blockProperties.description: Returns the text last selected in the ListView.

blockProperties.name: SelectionColor
blockProperties.description: The color of the item when it is selected.

blockProperties.name: SelectionIndex
blockProperties.description: The index of the currently selected item, starting at 1.  If no item is selected, the value will be 0.  If an attempt is made to set this to a number less than 1 or greater than the number of items in the ListView, SelectionIndex will be set to 0, and Selection will be set to the empty text.

blockProperties.name: ShowFilterBar
blockProperties.description: Sets visibility of ShowFilterBar. True will show the bar, False will hide it.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: The text color of the listview items.

blockProperties.name: TextSize
blockProperties.description: The text size of the listview items.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

blockProperties.name: Width
blockProperties.description: Determines the width of the list on the view.

events.name: AfterPicking
events.description: Simple event to be raised after the an element has been chosen in the list. The selected element is available in the Selection property.

name: LocationSensor
helpString:
Non-visible component providing location information, including longitude, latitude, altitude (if supported by the device), speed (if supported by the device), and address. This can also perform "geocoding", converting a given address (not necessarily the current one) to a latitude (with the LatitudeFromAddress method) and a longitude (with the LongitudeFromAddress method).

In order to function, the component must have its Enabled property set to True, and the device must have location sensing enabled through wireless networks or GPS satellites (if outdoors).

Location information might not be immediately available when an app starts. You'll have to wait a short time for a location provider to be found and used, or wait for the OnLocationChanged event

blockProperties.name: DistanceInterval
blockProperties.description: Determines the minimum distance interval, in meters, that the sensor will try to use for sending out location updates. For example, if this is set to 5, then the sensor will fire a LocationChanged event only after 5 meters have been traversed. However, the sensor does not guarantee that an update will be received at exactly the distance interval. It may take more than 5 meters to fire an event, for instance.

blockProperties.name: TimeInterval
blockProperties.description: Determines the minimum time interval, in milliseconds, that the sensor will try to use for sending out location updates. However, location updates will only be received when the location of the phone actually changes, and use of the specified time interval is not guaranteed. For example, if 1000 is used as the time interval, location updates will never be fired sooner than 1000ms, but they may be fired anytime after.

events.name: LocationChanged
events.description: Indicates that a new location has been detected.

events.name: StatusChanged
events.description:
Indicates that the status of the location provider service has changed, such as when a
 provider is lost or a new provider starts being used.

methods.name: LatitudeFromAddress
methods.description: Derives latitude of given address

methods.name: LongitudeFromAddress
methods.description: Derives longitude of given address

name: MediaStore
helpString: Non-visible component that communicates with a Web service and stores media files.

events.name: MediaStored
events.description: Indicates that a MediaStored server request has succeeded.

events.name: WebServiceError
events.description: Indicates that the communication with the Web service signaled an error

methods.name: PostMedia
methods.description: Asks the Web service to store the given media file.

name: NearField
helpString:
Non-visible component to provide NFC capabilities. For now this component supports the reading and writing of text tags only (if supported by the device)

In order to read and write text tags, the component must have its ReadMode property set to True or False respectively.

Note: This component will only work on Screen1 of any App Inventor app.

events.name: TagRead
events.description:
Indicates that a new tag has been detected.
 Currently this is only a plain text tag, as specified in the
 manifest.  See Compiler.java.

events.name: TagWritten
events.description: Event for TagWritten

name: Notifier
helpString:
The Notifier component displays alert dialogs, messages, and temporary alerts, and creates Android log entries through the following methods:
  • ShowMessageDialog: displays a message which the user must dismiss by pressing a button.
  • ShowChooseDialog: displays a message two buttons to let the user choose one of two responses, for example, yes or no, after which the AfterChoosing event is raised.
  • ShowTextDialog: lets the user enter text in response to the message, after which the AfterTextInput event is raised.
  • ShowAlert: displays a temporary alert that goes away by itself after a short time.
  • ShowProgressDialog: displays an alert with a loading spinner that cannot be dismissed by the user. It can only be dismissed by using the DismissProgressDialog block.
  • DismissProgressDialog: Dismisses the progress dialog displayed by ShowProgressDialog.
  • LogError: logs an error message to the Android log.
  • LogInfo: logs an info message to the Android log.
  • LogWarning: logs a warning message to the Android log.
  • The messages in the dialogs (but not the alert) can be formatted using the following HTML tags:<b>, <big>, <blockquote>, <br>, <cite>, <dfn>, <div>, <em>, <small>, <strong>, <sub>, <sup>, <tt>. <u>
  • You can also use the font tag to specify color, for example, <font color="blue">. Some of the available color names are aqua, black, blue, fuchsia, green, grey, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, red, silver, teal, white, and yellow

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Specifies the background color for alerts (not dialogs).

blockProperties.name: NotifierLength
blockProperties.description: specifies the length of time that the alert is shown -- either "short" or "long".

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Specifies the text color for alerts (not dialogs).

events.name: AfterChoosing
events.description: Event after the user has made a selection for ShowChooseDialog.

events.name: AfterTextInput
events.description: Event raised after the user has responded to ShowTextDialog.

methods.name: DismissProgressDialog
methods.description: Dismiss a previously displayed ProgressDialog box

methods.name: LogError
methods.description: Writes an error message to the Android system log. See the Google Android documentation for how to access the log.

methods.name: LogInfo
methods.description: Writes an information message to the Android log.

methods.name: LogWarning
methods.description: Writes a warning message to the Android log. See the Google Android documentation for how to access the log.

methods.name: ShowAlert
methods.description: Display a temporary notification

methods.name: ShowChooseDialog
methods.description: Shows a dialog box with two buttons, from which the user can choose.  If cancelable is true there will be an additional CANCEL button. Pressing a button will raise the AfterChoosing event.  The "choice" parameter to AfterChoosing will be the text on the button that was pressed, or "Cancel" if the  CANCEL button was pressed.

methods.name: ShowMessageDialog
methods.description: Display an alert dialog with a single button that dismisses the alert.

methods.name: ShowProgressDialog
methods.description: Shows a dialog box with an optional title and message (use empty strings if they are not wanted). This dialog box contains a spinning artifact to indicate that the program is working. It cannot be canceled by the user but must be dismissed by the App Inventor Program by using the DismissProgressDialog block.

methods.name: ShowTextDialog
methods.description: Shows a dialog box where the user can enter text, after which the AfterTextInput event will be raised.  If cancelable is true there will be an additional CANCEL button. Entering text will raise the AfterTextInput event.  The "response" parameter to AfterTextInput will be the text that was entered, or "Cancel" if the CANCEL button was pressed.

name: NxtColorSensor
helpString: A component that provides a high-level interface to a color sensor on a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot.

blockProperties.name: AboveRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the AboveRange event should fire when the DetectColor property is set to False and the light level goes above the TopOfRange.

blockProperties.name: BelowRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the BelowRange event should fire when the DetectColor property is set to False and the light level goes below the BottomOfRange.

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient
blockProperties.description: The BluetoothClient component that should be used for communication.

blockProperties.name: BottomOfRange
blockProperties.description: The bottom of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

blockProperties.name: ColorChangedEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the ColorChanged event should fire when the DetectColor property is set to True and the detected color changes.

blockProperties.name: DetectColor
blockProperties.description: Whether the sensor should detect color or light. True indicates that the sensor should detect color; False indicates that the sensor should detect light. If the DetectColor property is set to True, the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events will not occur and the sensor will not generate color. If the DetectColor property is set to False, the ColorChanged event will not occur.

blockProperties.name: GenerateColor
blockProperties.description: The color that should generated by the sensor. Only None, Red, Green, or Blue are valid values. The sensor will not generate color when the DetectColor property is set to True.

blockProperties.name: SensorPort
blockProperties.description: The sensor port that the sensor is connected to.

blockProperties.name: TopOfRange
blockProperties.description: The top of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

blockProperties.name: WithinRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the WithinRange event should fire when the DetectColor property is set to False and the light level goes between the BottomOfRange and the TopOfRange.

events.name: AboveRange
events.description: Light level has gone above the range. The AboveRange event will not occur if the DetectColor property is set to True or if the AboveRangeEventEnabled property is set to False.

events.name: BelowRange
events.description: Light level has gone below the range. The BelowRange event will not occur if the DetectColor property is set to True or if the BelowRangeEventEnabled property is set to False.

events.name: ColorChanged
events.description: Detected color has changed. The ColorChanged event will not occur if the DetectColor property is set to False or if the ColorChangedEventEnabled property is set to False.

events.name: WithinRange
events.description: Light level has gone within the range. The WithinRange event will not occur if the DetectColor property is set to True or if the WithinRangeEventEnabled property is set to False.

methods.name: GetColor
methods.description: Returns the current detected color, or the color None if the color can not be read or if the DetectColor property is set to False.

methods.name: GetLightLevel
methods.description: Returns the current light level as a value between 0 and 1023, or -1 if the light level can not be read or if the DetectColor property is set to True.

name: NxtDirectCommands
helpString: A component that provides a low-level interface to a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot, with functions to send NXT Direct Commands.

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient
blockProperties.description: The BluetoothClient component that should be used for communication.

methods.name: DeleteFile
methods.description: Delete a file on the robot.

methods.name: DownloadFile
methods.description: Download a file to the robot.

methods.name: GetBatteryLevel
methods.description: Get the battery level for the robot. Returns the voltage in millivolts.

methods.name: GetBrickName
methods.description: Get the brick name of the robot.

methods.name: GetCurrentProgramName
methods.description: Get the name of currently running program on the robot.

methods.name: GetFirmwareVersion
methods.description: Get the firmware and protocol version numbers for the robot as a list where the first element is the firmware version number and the second element is the protocol version number.

methods.name: GetInputValues
methods.description: Reads the values of an input sensor on the robot. Assumes sensor type has been configured via SetInputMode.

methods.name: GetOutputState
methods.description: Reads the output state of a motor on the robot.

methods.name: KeepAlive
methods.description: Keep Alive. Returns the current sleep time limit in milliseconds.

methods.name: ListFiles
methods.description: Returns a list containing the names of matching files found on the robot.

methods.name: LsGetStatus
methods.description: Returns the count of available bytes to read.

methods.name: LsRead
methods.description: Reads unsigned low speed data from an input sensor on the robot. Assumes sensor type has been configured via SetInputMode.

methods.name: LsWrite
methods.description: Writes low speed data to an input sensor on the robot. Assumes sensor type has been configured via SetInputMode.

methods.name: MessageRead
methods.description: Read a message from a mailbox (1-10) on the robot.

methods.name: MessageWrite
methods.description: Write a message to a mailbox (1-10) on the robot.

methods.name: PlaySoundFile
methods.description: Play a sound file on the robot.

methods.name: PlayTone
methods.description: Make the robot play a tone.

methods.name: ResetInputScaledValue
methods.description: Reset the scaled value of an input sensor on the robot.

methods.name: ResetMotorPosition
methods.description: Reset motor position.

methods.name: SetBrickName
methods.description: Set the brick name of the robot.

methods.name: SetInputMode
methods.description: Configure an input sensor on the robot.

methods.name: SetOutputState
methods.description: Sets the output state of a motor on the robot.

methods.name: StartProgram
methods.description: Start execution of a previously downloaded program on the robot.

methods.name: StopProgram
methods.description: Stop execution of the currently running program on the robot.

methods.name: StopSoundPlayback
methods.description: Stop sound playback.

name: NxtDrive
helpString: A component that provides a high-level interface to a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot, with functions that can move and turn the robot.

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient
blockProperties.description: The BluetoothClient component that should be used for communication.

blockProperties.name: DriveMotors
blockProperties.description: The motor ports that are used for driving: the left wheel's motor port followed by the right wheel's motor port.

blockProperties.name: StopBeforeDisconnect
blockProperties.description: Whether to stop the drive motors before disconnecting.

blockProperties.name: WheelDiameter
blockProperties.description: The diameter of the wheels used for driving.

methods.name: MoveBackward
methods.description: Move the robot backward the given distance, with the specified percentage of maximum power, by powering both drive motors backward.

methods.name: MoveBackwardIndefinitely
methods.description: Move the robot backward indefinitely, with the specified percentage of maximum power, by powering both drive motors backward.

methods.name: MoveForward
methods.description: Move the robot forward the given distance, with the specified percentage of maximum power, by powering both drive motors forward.

methods.name: MoveForwardIndefinitely
methods.description: Move the robot forward indefinitely, with the specified percentage of maximum power, by powering both drive motors forward.

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stop the drive motors of the robot.

methods.name: TurnClockwiseIndefinitely
methods.description: Turn the robot clockwise indefinitely, with the specified percentage of maximum power, by powering the left drive motor forward and the right drive motor backward.

methods.name: TurnCounterClockwiseIndefinitely
methods.description: Turn the robot counterclockwise indefinitely, with the specified percentage of maximum power, by powering the right drive motor forward and the left drive motor backward.

blockProperties.name: BelowRangeEventEnabled

blockProperties.name: BottomOfRange

blockProperties.name: SensorPort

blockProperties.name: TopOfRange
blockProperties.description: The top of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

blockProperties.name: WithinRangeEventEnabled

events.name: AboveRange

events.name: BelowRange

events.name: WithinRange

methods.name: GetLightLevel

name: NxtSoundSensor
helpString: A component that provides a high-level interface to a sound sensor on a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot.

blockProperties.name: AboveRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the AboveRange event should fire when the sound level goes above the TopOfRange.

blockProperties.name: BelowRangeEventEnabled

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient

blockProperties.name: BottomOfRange
blockProperties.description: The bottom of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

blockProperties.name: SensorPort

blockProperties.name: TopOfRange
blockProperties.description: The top of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

events.name: BelowRange

name: NxtTouchSensor
helpString: A component that provides a high-level interface to a touch sensor on a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot.

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient
blockProperties.description: The BluetoothClient component that should be used for communication.

blockProperties.name: PressedEventEnabled

blockProperties.name: ReleasedEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the Released event should fire when the touch sensor is released.

blockProperties.name: SensorPort
blockProperties.description: The sensor port that the sensor is connected to.

events.name: Pressed

events.name: Released
events.description: Touch sensor has been released.

methods.name: IsPressed

name: NxtUltrasonicSensor
helpString: A component that provides a high-level interface to an ultrasonic sensor on a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot.

blockProperties.name: AboveRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the AboveRange event should fire when the distance goes above the TopOfRange.

blockProperties.name: BelowRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the BelowRange event should fire when the distance goes below the BottomOfRange.

blockProperties.name: BluetoothClient
