blockProperties.name: BottomOfRange
blockProperties.description: The bottom of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

blockProperties.name: SensorPort
blockProperties.description: The sensor port that the sensor is connected to.

blockProperties.name: TopOfRange
blockProperties.description: The top of the range used for the BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events.

blockProperties.name: WithinRangeEventEnabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the WithinRange event should fire when the distance goes between the BottomOfRange and the TopOfRange.

events.name: AboveRange
events.description: Distance has gone above the range.

events.name: BelowRange
events.description: Distance has gone below the range.

events.name: WithinRange
events.description: Distance has gone within the range.

methods.name: GetDistance
methods.description: Returns the current distance in centimeters as a value between 0 and 254, or -1 if the distance can not be read.

name: OrientationSensor
helpString:
Non-visible component providing information about the device's physical orientation in three dimensions:

  • Roll: 0 degrees when the device is level, increases to 90 degrees as the device is tilted up on its left side, and decreases to -90 degrees when the device is tilted up on its right side.
  • Pitch: 0 degrees when the device is level, up to 90 degrees as the device is tilted so its top is pointing down, up to 180 degrees as it gets turned over. Similarly, as the device is tilted so its bottom points down, pitch decreases to -90 degrees, then further decreases to -180 degrees as it gets turned all the way over.
  • Azimuth: 0 degrees when the top of the device is pointing north, 90 degrees when it is pointing east, 180 degrees when it is pointing south, 270 degrees when it is pointing west, etc.
These measurements assume that the device itself is not moving.

events.name: OrientationChanged
events.description:
Default OrientationChanged event handler.

This event is signalled when the device's orientation has changed. It reports the new values of azimuth, pich, and roll, and it also sets the Azimuth, Pitch, and roll properties.

Azimuth is the compass heading in degrees, pitch indicates how the device is tilted from top to bottom, and roll indicates how much the device is tilted from side to side.

name: PasswordTextBox
helpString:
A box for entering passwords. This is the same as the ordinary TextBox component except this does not display the characters typed by the user.

The value of the text in the box can be found or set through the Text property. If blank, the Hint property, which appears as faint text in the box, can provide the user with guidance as to what to type.

Text boxes are usually used with the Button component, with the user clicking on the button when text entry is complete.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: The background color of the input box.  You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.  The default background color is 'default' (shaded 3-D look).

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the user can enter text into this input box.  By default, this is true.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: Whether the font for the text should be bold.  By default, it is not.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: Whether the text should appear in italics.  By default, it does not.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: The font size for the text.  By default, it is 14.0 points.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: The font for the text.  The value can be changed in the Designer.

blockProperties.name: Hint
blockProperties.description: Text that should appear faintly in the input box to provide a hint as to what the user should enter. This can only be seen if the Text property is empty.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: The text in the input box, which can be set by the programmer in the Designer or Blocks Editor, or it can be entered by the user (unless the Enabled property is false).

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Whether the text should be left justified, centered, or right justified.  By default, text is left justified.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: The color for the text.  You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.  The default text color is black.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description:
Event raised when this component is selected for input, such as by
 the user touching it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description:
Event raised when this component is no longer selected for input, such
 as if the user touches a different text box.

methods.name: RequestFocus
methods.description: Sets the textbox active.

name: Pedometer
helpString: A Component that acts like a Pedometer. It senses motion via the Accerleromter and attempts to determine if a step has been taken. Using a configurable stride length, it can estimate the distance traveled as well.

blockProperties.name: Distance
blockProperties.description: The approximate distance traveled in meters.

blockProperties.name: ElapsedTime
blockProperties.description: Time elapsed in milliseconds since the pedometer was started.

blockProperties.name: SimpleSteps
blockProperties.description: The number of simple steps taken since the pedometer has started.

blockProperties.name: StopDetectionTimeout
blockProperties.description: The duration in milliseconds of idleness (no steps detected) after which to go into a "stopped" state

blockProperties.name: StrideLength
blockProperties.description: Set the average stride length in meters.

blockProperties.name: WalkSteps
blockProperties.description: the number of walk steps taken since the pedometer has started.

events.name: CalibrationFailed
events.description: Event for CalibrationFailed

events.name: GPSAvailable
events.description: Event for GPSAvailable

events.name: GPSLost
events.description: Event for GPSLost

events.name: SimpleStep
events.description: This event is run when a raw step is detected

events.name: StartedMoving
events.description: Event for StartedMoving

events.name: StoppedMoving
events.description: Event for StoppedMoving

events.name: WalkStep
events.description: This event is run when a walking step is detected. A walking step is a step that appears to be involved in forward motion.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Pause counting of steps and distance.

methods.name: Reset
methods.description: Resets the step counter, distance measure and time running.

methods.name: Resume
methods.description: Resumes counting, synonym of Start.

methods.name: Save
methods.description: Saves the pedometer state to the phone. Permits permits accumulation of steps and distance between invocations of an App that uses the pedometer. Different Apps will have their own saved state.

methods.name: Start
methods.description: Start counting steps

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stop counting steps

name: PhoneCall
helpString:
A non-visible component that makes a phone call to the number specified in the PhoneNumber property, which can be set either in the Designer or Blocks Editor. The component has a MakePhoneCall method, enabling the program to launch a phone call.

Often, this component is used with the ContactPicker component, which lets the user select a contact from the ones stored on the phone and sets the PhoneNumber property to the contact's phone number.

To directly specify the phone number (e.g., 650-555-1212), set the PhoneNumber property to a Text with the specified digits (e.g., "6505551212"). Dashes, dots, and parentheses may be included (e.g., "(650)-555-1212") but will be ignored; spaces may not be included.

events.name: IncomingCallAnswered
events.description: Event indicating that an incoming phone call is answered. phoneNumber is the incoming call phone number.

events.name: PhoneCallEnded
events.description: Event indicating that a phone call has ended. If status is 1, incoming call is missed or rejected; if status is 2, incoming call is answered before hanging up; if status is 3, outgoing call is hung up. phoneNumber is the ended call phone number.

events.name: PhoneCallStarted
events.description: Event indicating that a phonecall has started. If status is 1, incoming call is ringing; if status is 2, outgoing call is dialled. phoneNumber is the incoming/outgoing phone number.

methods.name: MakePhoneCall
methods.description: Makes a phone call using the number in the PhoneNumber property.

name: PhoneNumberPicker
helpString:
A button that, when clicked on, displays a list of the contacts' phone numbers to choose among. After the user has made a selection, the following properties will be set to information about the chosen contact:
  • ContactName: the contact's name
  • PhoneNumber: the contact's phone number
  • EmailAddress: the contact's email address
  • Picture: the name of the file containing the contact's image, which can be used as a Picture property value for the Image or ImageSprite component.

Other properties affect the appearance of the button (TextAlignment, BackgroundColor, etc.) and whether it can be clicked on (Enabled).

The PhoneNumberPicker component may not work on all Android devices. For example, on Android systems before system 3.0, the returned lists of phone numbers and email addresses will be empty.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: ContactUri
blockProperties.description: URI that specifies the location of the contact on the device.

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: Point size for button text.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: Font family for button text.

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Image to display on button.

blockProperties.name: Shape
blockProperties.description: Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed.

blockProperties.name: ShowFeedback
blockProperties.description: Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown  for a button that as an image as background.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: Text to display on button.

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Left, center, or right.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Color for button text.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: AfterPicking
events.description:
Event to be raised after the picker activity returns its
 result and the properties have been filled in.

events.name: BeforePicking
events.description:
Event to raise when the button of the component is clicked or the list is shown
 using the Open block.  This event occurs before the list of items is displayed, and 
 can be used to prepare the list before it is shown.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description: Indicates that the button was pressed down.

events.name: TouchUp
events.description: Indicates that a button has been released.

methods.name: Open
methods.description: Opens the picker, as though the user clicked on it.

methods.name: ViewContact
methods.description: view a contact via its URI

name: PhoneStatus
helpString: Component that returns information about the phone.

events.name: OnSettings
events.description:
This event is fired when the "settings" menu item is selected (only available in the
 Companion App, defined in ReplForm.java).

methods.name: GetWifiIpAddress
methods.description: Returns the IP address of the phone in the form of a String

methods.name: doFault
methods.description: Causes an Exception, used to debug exception processing.

methods.name: getVersionName
methods.description: Obtain the Android Application Version

methods.name: installURL
methods.description: Downloads the URL and installs it as an Android Package

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns TRUE if the phone is on Wifi, FALSE otherwise

methods.name: isDirect
methods.description: Returns true if we are running in the emulator or USB Connection

methods.name: setAssetsLoaded
methods.description: Declare that we have loaded our initial assets and other assets should come from the sdcard

methods.name: setHmacSeedReturnCode
methods.description: Establish the secret seed for HOTP generation. Return the SHA1 of the provided seed, this will be used to contact the rendezvous server.

methods.name: shutdown
methods.description: Really Exit the Application

methods.name: startHTTPD
methods.description: Start the internal AppInvHTTPD to listen for incoming forms. FOR REPL USE ONLY!

name: Player
helpString:
Multimedia component that plays audio and controls phone vibration. The name of a multimedia field is specified in the Source property, which can be set in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor. The length of time for a vibration is specified in the Blocks Editor in milliseconds (thousandths of a second).

For supported audio formats, see Android Supported Media Formats.

This component is best for long sound files, such as songs, while the Sound component is more efficient for short files, such as sound effects.

blockProperties.name: IsPlaying
blockProperties.description: Reports whether the media is playing

blockProperties.name: Loop
blockProperties.description: If true, the player will loop when it plays. Setting Loop while the player is playing will affect the current playing.

blockProperties.name: PlayOnlyInForeground
blockProperties.description: If true, the player will pause playing when leaving the current screen; if false (default option), the player continues playing whenever the current screen is displaying or not.

blockProperties.name: Volume
blockProperties.description: Sets the volume to a number between 0 and 100

events.name: Completed
events.description: Indicates that the media has reached the end

events.name: OtherPlayerStarted
events.description: This event is signaled when another player has started (and the current player is playing or paused, but not stopped).

events.name: PlayerError
events.description: The PlayerError event is no longer used. Please use the Screen.ErrorOccurred event instead.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Suspends playing the media if it is playing.

methods.name: Start
methods.description:
Plays the media.  If it was previously paused, the playing is resumed.
 If it was previously stopped, it starts from the beginning.

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stops playing the media and seeks to the beginning of the song.

methods.name: Vibrate
methods.description: Vibrates for specified number of milliseconds.

name: ProximitySensor
helpString: Non-visible component that can measures the proximity of an object in cm relative to the view screen of a device. This sensor is typically used to determine whether a handset is being held up to a persons ear; i.e. lets you determine how far away an object is from a device. Many devices return the absolute distance, in cm, but some return only near and far values. In this case, the sensor usually reports its maximum range value in the far state and a lesser value in the near state.

blockProperties.name: Available
blockProperties.description: Reports whether or not the device has a proximity sensor

blockProperties.name: Distance
blockProperties.description: Returns the distance from the object to the device

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If enabled, then device will listen for changes in proximity

blockProperties.name: KeepRunningWhenOnPause
blockProperties.description: If set to true, it will keep sensing for proximity changes even when the app is not visible

blockProperties.name: MaximumRange
blockProperties.description: Reports the Maximum Range of the device's ProximitySensor

events.name: ProximityChanged
events.description: Triggered when distance (in cm) of the object to the device changes.

name: Sharing
helpString:
Sharing is a non-visible component that enables sharing files and/or messages between your app and other apps installed on a device. The component will display a list of the installed apps that can handle the information provided, and will allow the user to choose one to share the content with, for instance a mail app, a social network app, a texting app, and so on.
The file path can be taken directly from other components such as the Camera or the ImagePicker, but can also be specified directly to read from storage. Be aware that different devices treat storage differently, so a few things to try if, for instance, you have a file called arrow.gif in the folder Appinventor/assets, would be:
  • "file:///sdcard/Appinventor/assets/arrow.gif"
    • or
  • "/storage/Appinventor/assets/arrow.gif"

methods.name: ShareFile
methods.description: Shares a file through any capable application installed on the phone by displaying a list of the available apps and allowing the user to choose one from the list. The selected app will open with the file inserted on it.

methods.name: ShareFileWithMessage
methods.description: Shares both a file and a message through any capable application installed on the phone by displaying a list of available apps and allowing the user to  choose one from the list. The selected app will open with the file and message inserted on it.

methods.name: ShareMessage
methods.description: Shares a message through any capable application installed on the phone by displaying a list of the available apps and allowing the user to choose one from the list. The selected app will open with the message inserted on it.

name: Slider
helpString: A Slider is a progress bar that adds a draggable thumb. You can touch the thumb and drag left or right to set the slider thumb position. As the Slider thumb is dragged, it will trigger the PositionChanged event, reporting the position of the Slider thumb. The reported position of the Slider thumb can be used to dynamically update another component attribute, such as the font size of a TextBox or the radius of a Ball.

blockProperties.name: ColorLeft
blockProperties.description: The color of slider to the left of the thumb.

blockProperties.name: ColorRight
blockProperties.description: The color of slider to the left of the thumb.

blockProperties.name: MaxValue
blockProperties.description: Sets the maximum value of slider.  Changing the maximum value also resets Thumbposition to be halfway between the minimum and the (new) maximum. If the new maximum is less than the current minimum, then minimum and maximum will both be set to this value.  Setting MaxValue resets the thumb position to halfway between MinValue and MaxValue and signals the PositionChanged event.

blockProperties.name: MinValue
blockProperties.description: Sets the minimum value of slider.  Changing the minimum value also resets Thumbposition to be halfway between the (new) minimum and the maximum. If the new minimum is greater than the current maximum, then minimum and maximum will both be set to this value.  Setting MinValue resets the thumb position to halfway between MinValue and MaxValue and signals the PositionChanged event.

blockProperties.name: ThumbEnabled
blockProperties.description: Sets whether or not to display the slider thumb.

blockProperties.name: ThumbPosition
blockProperties.description: Sets the position of the slider thumb. If this value is greater than MaxValue, then it will be set to same value as MaxValue. If this value is less than MinValue, then it will be set to same value as MinValue.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: PositionChanged
events.description: Indicates that position of the slider thumb has changed.

name: Sound
helpString:
A multimedia component that plays sound files and optionally vibrates for the number of milliseconds (thousandths of a second) specified in the Blocks Editor. The name of the sound file to play can be specified either in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.

For supported sound file formats, see Android Supported Media Formats.

This Sound component is best for short sound files, such as sound effects, while the Player component is more efficient for longer sounds, such as songs.

You might get an error if you attempt to play a sound immeditely after setting the source.

blockProperties.name: MinimumInterval
blockProperties.description: The minimum interval, in milliseconds, between sounds.  If you play a sound, all further Play() calls will be ignored until the interval has elapsed.

blockProperties.name: Source
blockProperties.description: The name of the sound file.  Only certain formats are supported.  See http://developer.android.com/guide/appendix/media-formats.html.

events.name: SoundError
events.description: The SoundError event is no longer used. Please use the Screen.ErrorOccurred event instead.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Pauses playing the sound if it is being played.

methods.name: Play
methods.description: Plays the sound specified by the Source property.

methods.name: Resume
methods.description: Resumes playing the sound after a pause.

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stops playing the sound if it is being played.

methods.name: Vibrate
methods.description: Vibrates for the specified number of milliseconds.

name: SoundRecorder
helpString: Multimedia component that records audio.

blockProperties.name: SavedRecording
blockProperties.description: Specifies the path to the file where the recording should be stored. If this proprety is the empty string, then starting a recording will create a file in an appropriate location.  If the property is not the empty string, it should specify a complete path to a file in an existing directory, including a file name with the extension .3gp.

events.name: AfterSoundRecorded
events.description: Provides the location of the newly created sound.

events.name: StartedRecording
events.description: Indicates that the recorder has started, and can be stopped.

events.name: StoppedRecording
events.description: Indicates that the recorder has stopped, and can be started again.

methods.name: Start
methods.description: Starts recording.

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stops recording.

name: SpeechRecognizer
helpString: Component for using Voice Recognition to convert from speech to text

events.name: AfterGettingText
events.description: Simple event to raise after the VoiceReco activity has returned

events.name: BeforeGettingText
events.description:
Simple event to raise when VoiceReco is invoked but before the VoiceReco
 activity is started.

methods.name: GetText
methods.description:
Solicits speech input from the user.  After the speech is converted to
 text, the AfterGettingText event will be raised.

name: Spinner
helpString: A spinner component that displays a pop-up with a list of elements. These elements can be set in the Designer or Blocks Editor by setting theElementsFromString property to a string-separated concatenation (for example, choice 1, choice 2, choice 3) or by setting the Elements property to a List in the Blocks editor. Spinners are created with the first item already selected. So selecting it does not generate an After Picking event. Consequently it's useful to make the first Spinner item be a non-choice like "Select from below...".

blockProperties.name: Elements
blockProperties.description: returns a list of text elements to be picked from.

blockProperties.name: ElementsFromString
blockProperties.description: sets the Spinner list to the elements passed in the comma-separated string

blockProperties.name: Prompt
blockProperties.description: Text with the current title for the Spinner window

blockProperties.name: Selection
blockProperties.description: Returns the current selected item in the spinner

blockProperties.name: SelectionIndex
blockProperties.description: The index of the currently selected item, starting at 1. If no item is selected, the value will be 0.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: AfterSelecting
events.description: Event called after the user selects an item from the dropdown list.

methods.name: DisplayDropdown
methods.description: displays the dropdown list for selection, same action as when the user clicks on the spinner.

name: TableArrangement
helpString: A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed in tabular form.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: TextBox
helpString:
A box for the user to enter text. The initial or user-entered text value is in the Text property. If blank, the Hint property, which appears as faint text in the box, can provide the user with guidance as to what to type.

The MultiLine property determines if the text can havemore than one line. For a single line text box, the keyboard will closeautomatically when the user presses the Done key. To close the keyboard for multiline text boxes, the app should use the HideKeyboard method or rely on the user to press the Back key.

The NumbersOnly property restricts the keyboard to acceptnumeric input only.

Other properties affect the appearance of the text box (TextAlignment, BackgroundColor, etc.) and whether it can be used (Enabled).

Text boxes are usually used with the Button component, with the user clicking on the button when text entry is complete.

If the text entered by the user should not be displayed, use PasswordTextBox instead.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: The background color of the input box.  You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.  The default background color is 'default' (shaded 3-D look).

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: Whether the user can enter text into this input box.  By default, this is true.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: Whether the font for the text should be bold.  By default, it is not.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: Whether the text should appear in italics.  By default, it does not.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: The font size for the text.  By default, it is 14.0 points.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: The font for the text.  The value can be changed in the Designer.

blockProperties.name: Hint
blockProperties.description: Text that should appear faintly in the input box to provide a hint as to what the user should enter. This can only be seen if the Text property is empty.

blockProperties.name: MultiLine
blockProperties.description: If true, then this text box accepts multiple lines of input, which are entered using the return key.  For single line text boxes there is a Done key instead of a return key, and pressing Done hides the keyboard.  The app should call the HideKeyboard method to hide the keyboard for a mutiline text box.

blockProperties.name: NumbersOnly
blockProperties.description: If true, then this text box accepts only numbers as keyboard input.  Numbers can include a decimal point and an optional leading minus sign.  This applies to keyboard input only.  Even if NumbersOnly is true, you can use [set Text to] to enter any text at all.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: The text in the input box, which can be set by the programmer in the Designer or Blocks Editor, or it can be entered by the user (unless the Enabled property is false).

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Whether the text should be left justified, centered, or right justified.  By default, text is left justified.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: The color for the text.  You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor.  The default text color is black.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description:
Event raised when this component is selected for input, such as by
 the user touching it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description:
Event raised when this component is no longer selected for input, such
 as if the user touches a different text box.

methods.name: HideKeyboard
methods.description: Hide the keyboard.  Only multiline text boxes need this. Single line text boxes close the keyboard when the users presses the Done key.

methods.name: RequestFocus
methods.description: Sets the textbox active.

name: TextToSpeech
helpString:
The TestToSpeech component speaks a given text aloud. You can set the pitch and the rate of speech.

You can also set a language by supplying a language code. This changes the pronounciation of words, not the actual language spoken. For example, setting the language to French and speaking English text will sound like someone speaking English (en) with a French accent.

You can also specify a country by supplying a country code. This can affect the pronounciation. For example, British English (GBR) will sound different from US English (USA). Not every country code will affect every language.

The languages and countries available depend on the particular device, and can be listed with the AvailableLanguages and AvailableCountries properties.

blockProperties.name: AvailableCountries
blockProperties.description: List of the country codes available on this device for use with TextToSpeech.  Check the Android developer documentation under supported languages to find the meanings of these abbreviations.

blockProperties.name: AvailableLanguages
blockProperties.description: List of the languages available on this device for use with TextToSpeech.  Check the Android developer documentation under supported languages to find the meanings of these abbreviations.

blockProperties.name: Country
blockProperties.description: Country code to use for speech generation.  This can affect the pronounciation.  For example, British English (GBR) will sound different from US English (USA).  Not every country code will affect every language.

blockProperties.name: Language
blockProperties.description: Sets the language for TextToSpeech. This changes the way that words are pronounced, not the actual language that is spoken.  For example setting the language to and speaking English text with sound like someone speaking English with a Frernch accent.

blockProperties.name: Pitch
blockProperties.description: Sets the Pitch for TextToSpeech The values should be between 0 and 2 where lower values lower the tone of synthesized voice and greater values raise it.

blockProperties.name: SpeechRate
blockProperties.description: Sets the SpeechRate for TextToSpeech. The values should be between 0 and 2 where lower values slow down the pitch and greater values accelerate it.

events.name: AfterSpeaking
events.description: Event to raise after the message is spoken.

events.name: BeforeSpeaking
events.description: Event to raise when Speak is invoked, before the message is spoken.

methods.name: Speak
methods.description: Speaks the given message.

name: Texting
helpString:
A component that will, when the SendMessage method is called, send the text message specified in the Message property to the phone number specified in the PhoneNumber property.

If the ReceivingEnabled property is set to 1 messages will not be received. If ReceivingEnabled is set to 2 messages will be received only when the application is running. Finally if ReceivingEnabled is set to 3, messages will be received when the application is running and when the application is not running they will be queued and a notification displayed to the user.

When a message arrives, the MessageReceived event is raised and provides the sending number and message.

An app that includes this component will receive messages even when it is in the background (i.e. when it's not visible on the screen) and, moreso, even if the app is not running, so long as it's installed on the phone. If the phone receives a text message when the app is not in the foreground, the phone will show a notification in the notification bar. Selecting the notification will bring up the app. As an app developer, you'll probably want to give your users the ability to control ReceivingEnabled so that they can make the phone ignore text messages.

If the GoogleVoiceEnabled property is true, messages can be sent over Wifi using Google Voice. This option requires that the user have a Google Voice account and that the mobile Voice app is installed on the phone. The Google Voice option works only on phones that support Android 2.0 (Eclair) or higher.

To specify the phone number (e.g., 650-555-1212), set the PhoneNumber property to a Text string with the specified digits (e.g., 6505551212). Dashes, dots, and parentheses may be included (e.g., (650)-555-1212) but will be ignored; spaces may not be included.

Another way for an app to specify a phone number would be to include a PhoneNumberPicker component, which lets the users select a phone numbers from the ones stored in the the phone's contacts.

blockProperties.name: GoogleVoiceEnabled
blockProperties.description: If true, then SendMessage will attempt to send messages over Wifi using Google Voice.  This requires that the Google Voice app must be installed and set up on the phone or tablet, with a Google Voice account.  If GoogleVoiceEnabled is false, the device must have phone and texting service in order to send or receive messages with this component.

blockProperties.name: Message
blockProperties.description: The message that will be sent when the SendMessage method is called.

blockProperties.name: PhoneNumber
blockProperties.description: The number that the message will be sent to when the SendMessage method is called. The number is a text string with the specified digits (e.g., 6505551212).  Dashes, dots, and parentheses may be included (e.g., (650)-555-1212) but will be ignored; spaces should not be included.

blockProperties.name: ReceivingEnabled
blockProperties.description: If set to 1 (OFF) no messages will be received.  If set to 2 (FOREGROUND) or3 (ALWAYS) the component will respond to messages if it is running. If the app is not running then the message will be discarded if set to 2 (FOREGROUND). If set to 3 (ALWAYS) and the app is not running the phone will show a notification.  Selecting the notification will bring up the app and signal the MessageReceived event.  Messages received when the app is dormant will be queued, and so several MessageReceived events might appear when the app awakens.  As an app developer, it would be a good idea to give your users control over this property, so they can make their phones ignore text messages when your app is installed.

events.name: MessageReceived
events.description: Event that's raised when a text message is received by the phone.

methods.name: SendMessage
methods.description: Send a text message

name: TimePicker
helpString: A button that, when clicked on, launches a popup dialog to allow the user to select a time.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the button's background color

blockProperties.name: Enabled
blockProperties.description: If set, user can tap check box to cause action.

blockProperties.name: FontBold
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in bold.

blockProperties.name: FontItalic
blockProperties.description: If set, button text is displayed in italics.

blockProperties.name: FontSize
blockProperties.description: Point size for button text.

blockProperties.name: FontTypeface
blockProperties.description: Font family for button text.

blockProperties.name: Hour
blockProperties.description: The hour of the last time set using the time picker. The hour is in a 24 hour format. If the last time set was 11:53 pm, this property will return 23.

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Image to display on button.

blockProperties.name: Instant
blockProperties.description: The instant of the last time set using the time picker

blockProperties.name: Minute
blockProperties.description: The minute of the last time set using the time picker

blockProperties.name: Shape
blockProperties.description: Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed.

blockProperties.name: ShowFeedback
blockProperties.description: Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown  for a button that as an image as background.

blockProperties.name: Text
blockProperties.description: Text to display on button.

blockProperties.name: TextAlignment
blockProperties.description: Left, center, or right.

blockProperties.name: TextColor
blockProperties.description: Color for button text.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

events.name: AfterTimeSet
events.description: This event is run when a user has set the time in the popup dialog.

events.name: GotFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

events.name: LostFocus
events.description: Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

events.name: TouchDown
events.description: Indicates that the button was pressed down.

events.name: TouchUp
events.description: Indicates that a button has been released.

methods.name: LaunchPicker
methods.description: Launches the TimePicker popup.

methods.name: SetTimeToDisplay
methods.description: Set the time to be shown in the Time Picker popup. Current time is shown by default.

methods.name: SetTimeToDisplayFromInstant
methods.description: Set the time from the instant to be shown in the Time Picker popup. Current time is shown by default.

name: TinyDB
helpString:
TinyDB is a non-visible component that stores data for an app.

Apps created with App Inventor are initialized each time they run: If an app sets the value of a variable and the user then quits the app, the value of that variable will not be remembered the next time the app is run. In contrast, TinyDB is a persistent data store for the app, that is, the data stored there will be available each time the app is run. An example might be a game that saves the high score and retrieves it each time the game is played.

Data items are strings stored under tags . To store a data item, you specify the tag it should be stored under. Subsequently, you can retrieve the data that was stored under a given tag.

There is only one data store per app. Even if you have multiple TinyDB components, they will use the same data store. To get the effect of separate stores, use different keys. Also each app has its own data store. You cannot use TinyDB to pass data between two different apps on the phone, although you can use TinyDb to shares data between the different screens of a multi-screen app.

When you are developing apps using the AI Companion, all the apps using that companion will share the same TinyDb. That sharing will disappear once the apps are packaged. But, during development, you should be careful to clear the TinyDb each time you start working on a new app.

methods.name: ClearAll
methods.description: Clear the entire data store

methods.name: ClearTag
methods.description: Clear the entry with the given tag

methods.name: GetTags
methods.description: Return a list of all the tags in the data store

methods.name: GetValue
methods.description: Retrieve the value stored under the given tag.  If there's no such tag, then return valueIfTagNotThere.

methods.name: StoreValue
methods.description:
Store the given value under the given tag.  The storage persists on the
 phone when the app is restarted.

name: TinyWebDB
helpString: Non-visible component that communicates with a Web service to store and retrieve information.

events.name: GotValue
events.description: Indicates that a GetValue server request has succeeded.

events.name: ValueStored
events.description: Event indicating that a StoreValue server request has succeeded.

events.name: WebServiceError
events.description: Indicates that the communication with the Web service signaled an error

methods.name: GetValue
methods.description:
GetValue asks the Web service to get the value stored under the given tag.
 It is up to the Web service what to return if there is no value stored
 under the tag.  This component just accepts whatever is returned.

methods.name: StoreValue
methods.description: Asks the Web service to store the given value under the given tag

name: Twitter
helpString:
A non-visible component that enables communication with Twitter. Once a user has logged into their Twitter account (and the authorization has been confirmed successful by the IsAuthorized event), many more operations are available:
  • Searching Twitter for tweets or labels (SearchTwitter)
  • Sending a Tweet (Tweet)
  • Sending a Tweet with an Image (TweetWithImage)
  • Directing a message to a specific user (DirectMessage)
  • Receiving the most recent messages directed to the logged-in user (RequestDirectMessages)
  • Following a specific user (Follow)
  • Ceasing to follow a specific user (StopFollowing)
  • Getting a list of users following the logged-in user (RequestFollowers)
  • Getting the most recent messages of users followed by the logged-in user (RequestFriendTimeline)
  • Getting the most recent mentions of the logged-in user (RequestMentions)

You must obtain a Consumer Key and Consumer Secret for Twitter authorization specific to your app from http://twitter.com/oauth_clients/new

blockProperties.name: ConsumerKey
blockProperties.description: The the consumer key to be used when authorizing with Twitter via OAuth.

blockProperties.name: ConsumerSecret
blockProperties.description: The consumer secret to be used when authorizing with Twitter via OAuth

blockProperties.name: DirectMessages
blockProperties.description:
This property contains a list of the most recent messages mentioning the logged-in user. Initially, the list is empty. To set it, the program must:
  1. Call the Authorize method.
  2. Wait for the Authorized event.
  3. Call the RequestDirectMessages method.
  4. Wait for the DirectMessagesReceived event.
The value of this property will then be set to the list of direct messages retrieved (and maintain that value until any subsequent call to RequestDirectMessages).

blockProperties.name: Followers
blockProperties.description:
This property contains a list of the followers of the logged-in user. Initially, the list is empty. To set it, the program must:
  1. Call the Authorize method.
  2. Wait for the IsAuthorized event.
  3. Call the RequestFollowers method.
  4. Wait for the FollowersReceived event.
The value of this property will then be set to the list of followers (and maintain its value until any subsequent call to RequestFollowers).

blockProperties.name: FriendTimeline
blockProperties.description:
This property contains the 20 most recent messages of users being followed. Initially, the list is empty. To set it, the program must:
  1. Call the Authorize method.
  2. Wait for the IsAuthorized event.
  3. Specify users to follow with one or more calls to the Follow method.
  4. Call the RequestFriendTimeline method.
  5. Wait for the FriendTimelineReceived event.
The value of this property will then be set to the list of messages (and maintain its value until any subsequent call to RequestFriendTimeline.

blockProperties.name: Mentions
blockProperties.description:
This property contains a list of mentions of the logged-in user. Initially, the list is empty. To set it, the program must:
  1. Call the Authorize method.
  2. Wait for the IsAuthorized event.
  3. Call the RequestMentions method.
  4. Wait for the MentionsReceived event.
The value of this property will then be set to the list of mentions (and will maintain its value until any subsequent calls to RequestMentions).

blockProperties.name: SearchResults
blockProperties.description:
This property, which is initially empty, is set to a list of search results after the program:
  1. Calls the SearchTwitter method.
  2. Waits for the SearchSuccessful event.
The value of the property will then be the same as the parameter to SearchSuccessful. Note that it is not necessary to call the Authorize method before calling SearchTwitter.

blockProperties.name: TwitPic_API_Key
blockProperties.description: The API Key for image uploading, provided by TwitPic.

blockProperties.name: Username
blockProperties.description: The user name of the authorized user. Empty if there is no authorized user.

events.name: DirectMessagesReceived
events.description: This event is raised when the recent messages requested through RequestDirectMessages have been retrieved. A list of the messages can then be found in the messages parameter or the Messages property.

events.name: FollowersReceived
events.description: This event is raised when all of the followers of the logged-in user requested through RequestFollowers have been retrieved. A list of the followers can then be found in the followers parameter or the Followers property.

events.name: FriendTimelineReceived
events.description: This event is raised when the messages requested through RequestFriendTimeline have been retrieved. The timeline parameter and the Timeline property will contain a list of lists, where each sub-list contains a status update of the form (username message)

events.name: IsAuthorized
events.description: This event is raised after the program calls Authorize if the authorization was successful. It is also called after a call to CheckAuthorized if we already have a valid access token. After this event has been raised, any other method for this component can be called.

events.name: MentionsReceived
events.description: This event is raised when the mentions of the logged-in user requested through RequestMentions have been retrieved. A list of the mentions can then be found in the mentions parameter or the Mentions property.

events.name: SearchSuccessful
events.description: This event is raised when the results of the search requested through SearchSuccessful have been retrieved. A list of the results can then be found in the results parameter or the Results property.

methods.name: Authorize
methods.description: Redirects user to login to Twitter via the Web browser using the OAuth protocol if we don't already have authorization.

methods.name: CheckAuthorized
methods.description: Checks whether we already have access, and if so, causes IsAuthorized event handler to be called.

methods.name: DeAuthorize
methods.description: Removes Twitter authorization from this running app instance

methods.name: DirectMessage
methods.description:
This sends a direct (private) message to the specified user. The message will be trimmed if it exceeds 160characters.

Requirements: This should only be called after the IsAuthorized event has been raised, indicating that the user has successfully logged in to Twitter.

methods.name: Follow
methods.description: Starts following a user.

methods.name: Login
methods.description: Twitter's API no longer supports login via username and password. Use the Authorize call instead.

methods.name: RequestDirectMessages
methods.description:
Requests the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the logged-in user. When the messages have been retrieved, the system will raise the DirectMessagesReceived event and set the DirectMessages property to the list of messages.

Requirements: This should only be called after the IsAuthorized event has been raised, indicating that the user has successfully logged in to Twitter.

methods.name: RequestFollowers
methods.description: Gets who is following you.

methods.name: RequestFriendTimeline
methods.description: Gets the most recent 20 messages in the user's timeline.

methods.name: RequestMentions
methods.description:
Requests the 20 most recent mentions of the logged-in user. When the mentions have been retrieved, the system will raise the MentionsReceived event and set the Mentions property to the list of mentions.

Requirements: This should only be called after the IsAuthorized event has been raised, indicating that the user has successfully logged in to Twitter.

methods.name: SearchTwitter
methods.description:
This searches Twitter for the given String query.

Requirements: This should only be called after the IsAuthorized event has been raised, indicating that the user has successfully logged in to Twitter.

methods.name: StopFollowing
methods.description: Stops following a user.

methods.name: Tweet
methods.description:
This sends a tweet as the logged-in user with the specified Text, which will be trimmed if it exceeds 160 characters.

Requirements: This should only be called after the IsAuthorized event has been raised, indicating that the user has successfully logged in to Twitter.

methods.name: TweetWithImage
methods.description:
This sends a tweet as the logged-in user with the specified Text and a path to the image to be uploaded, which will be trimmed if it exceeds 160 characters. If an image is not found or invalid, only the text will be tweeted.

Requirements: This should only be called after the IsAuthorized event has been raised, indicating that the user has successfully logged in to Twitter.

name: VerticalArrangement
helpString: A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed one below another. (The first child component is stored on top, the second beneath it, etc.) If you wish to have components displayed next to one another, use HorizontalArrangement instead.

blockProperties.name: AlignHorizontal
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned  horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned,  3 = horizontally centered.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic.

blockProperties.name: AlignVertical
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned  vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the component's background color

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Specifies the path of the component's image.  If there is both an Image and a BackgroundColor, only the Image will be visible.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: VerticalScrollArrangement
helpString:
A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed one below another. (The first child component is stored on top, the second beneath it, etc.) If you wish to have components displayed next to one another, use HorizontalArrangement instead.

This version is scrollable

blockProperties.name: AlignHorizontal
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned  horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned,  3 = horizontally centered.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic.

blockProperties.name: AlignVertical
blockProperties.description: A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned  vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom.  Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic.

blockProperties.name: BackgroundColor
blockProperties.description: Returns the component's background color

blockProperties.name: Image
blockProperties.description: Specifies the path of the component's image.  If there is both an Image and a BackgroundColor, only the Image will be visible.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

name: VideoPlayer
helpString:
A multimedia component capable of playing videos. When the application is run, the VideoPlayer will be displayed as a rectangle on-screen. If the user touches the rectangle, controls will appear to play/pause, skip ahead, and skip backward within the video. The application can also control behavior by calling the Start, Pause, and SeekTo methods.

Video files should be in 3GPP (.3gp) or MPEG-4 (.mp4) formats. For more details about legal formats, see Android Supported Media Formats.

App Inventor for Android only permits video files under 1 MB and limits the total size of an application to 5 MB, not all of which is available for media (video, audio, and sound) files. If your media files are too large, you may get errors when packaging or installing your application, in which case you should reduce the number of media files or their sizes. Most video editing software, such as Windows Movie Maker and Apple iMovie, can help you decrease the size of videos by shortening them or re-encoding the video into a more compact format.

You can also set the media source to a URL that points to a streaming video, but the URL must point to the video file itself, not to a program that plays the video.

blockProperties.name: Source
blockProperties.description: The "path" to the video.  Usually, this will be the name of the video file, which should be added in the Designer.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

blockProperties.name: Volume
blockProperties.description: Sets the volume to a number between 0 and 100. Values less than 0 will be treated as 0, and values greater than 100 will be treated as 100.

events.name: Completed
events.description: Indicates that the video has reached the end

events.name: VideoPlayerError
events.description: The VideoPlayerError event is no longer used. Please use the Screen.ErrorOccurred event instead.

methods.name: GetDuration
methods.description: Returns duration of the video in milliseconds.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Pauses playback of the video. Playback can be resumed at the same location by calling the Start method.

methods.name: SeekTo
methods.description: Seeks to the requested time (specified in milliseconds) in the video. If the video is paused, the frame shown will not be updated by the seek. The player can jump only to key frames in the video, so seeking to times that differ by short intervals may not actually move to different frames.

methods.name: Start
methods.description: Starts playback of the video.

name: Voting
helpString: The Voting component enables users to vote on a question by communicating with a Web service to retrieve a ballot and later sending back users' votes.

blockProperties.name: BallotOptions
blockProperties.description: The list of ballot options.

blockProperties.name: BallotQuestion
blockProperties.description: The question to be voted on.

blockProperties.name: ServiceURL
blockProperties.description: The URL of the Voting service

blockProperties.name: UserChoice
blockProperties.description: The ballot choice to send to the server, which must be set before SendBallot is called. This must be one of BallotOptions.

blockProperties.name: UserEmailAddress
blockProperties.description: The email address associated with this device. This property has been deprecated and always returns the empty text value.

blockProperties.name: UserId
blockProperties.description: A text identifying the voter that is sent to the Voting server along with the vote. This must be set before SendBallot is called.

events.name: GotBallot
events.description: Event indicating that a ballot was retrieved from the Web service and that the properties BallotQuestion and BallotOptions have been set. This is always preceded by a call to the method RequestBallot.

events.name: GotBallotConfirmation
events.description: Event confirming that the Voting service received the ballot.

events.name: NoOpenPoll
events.description: Event indicating that the service has no open poll.

events.name: WebServiceError
events.description:
Event indicating that the communication with the Web service resulted in
 an error.

methods.name: RequestBallot
methods.description: Send a request for a ballot to the Web service specified by the property ServiceURL. When the completes, one of the following events will be raised: GotBallot, NoOpenPoll, or WebServiceError.

methods.name: SendBallot
methods.description: Send a completed ballot to the Web service. This should not be called until the properties UserId and UserChoice have been set by the application.

name: Web
helpString: Non-visible component that provides functions for HTTP GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE requests.

blockProperties.name: AllowCookies
blockProperties.description: Whether the cookies from a response should be saved and used in subsequent requests. Cookies are only supported on Android version 2.3 or greater.

blockProperties.name: RequestHeaders
blockProperties.description: The request headers, as a list of two-element sublists. The first element of each sublist represents the request header field name. The second element of each sublist represents the request header field values, either a single value or a list containing multiple values.

blockProperties.name: ResponseFileName
blockProperties.description: The name of the file where the response should be saved. If SaveResponse is true and ResponseFileName is empty, then a new file name will be generated.

blockProperties.name: SaveResponse
blockProperties.description: Whether the response should be saved in a file.

blockProperties.name: Url
blockProperties.description: The URL for the web request.

events.name: GotFile
events.description: Event indicating that a request has finished.

events.name: GotText
events.description: Event indicating that a request has finished.

methods.name: BuildRequestData
methods.description:
Converts a list of two-element sublists, representing name and value pairs, to a
 string formatted as application/x-www-form-urlencoded media type, suitable to pass to
 PostText.

methods.name: ClearCookies
methods.description: Clears all cookies for this Web component.

methods.name: Delete
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP DELETE request using the Url property and retrieves the response.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: Get
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP GET request using the Url property and retrieves the response.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: HtmlTextDecode
methods.description: Decodes the given HTML text value. HTML character entities such as &amp;, &lt;, &gt;, &apos;, and &quot; are changed to &, <, >, ', and ". Entities such as &#xhhhh, and &#nnnn are changed to the appropriate characters.

methods.name: JsonTextDecode
methods.description:
Decodes the given JSON encoded value to produce a corresponding AppInventor value.
 A JSON list [x, y, z] decodes to a list (x y z),  A JSON object with name A and value B,
 (denoted as A:B enclosed in curly braces) decodes to a list
 ((A B)), that is, a list containing the two-element list (A B).

methods.name: PostFile
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP POST request using the Url property and data from the specified file.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: PostText
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP POST request using the Url property and the specified text.
The characters of the text are encoded using UTF-8 encoding.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The responseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: PostTextWithEncoding
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP POST request using the Url property and the specified text.
The characters of the text are encoded using the given encoding.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: PutFile
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP PUT request using the Url property and data from the specified file.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: PutText
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP PUT request using the Url property and the specified text.
The characters of the text are encoded using UTF-8 encoding.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The responseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: PutTextWithEncoding
methods.description:
Performs an HTTP PUT request using the Url property and the specified text.
The characters of the text are encoded using the given encoding.
If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

methods.name: UriEncode
methods.description: Encodes the given text value so that it can be used in a URL.

methods.name: XMLTextDecode
methods.description: Decodes the given XML string to produce a list structure.  See the App Inventor documentation on "Other topics, notes, and details" for information.

name: WebViewer
helpString:
Component for viewing Web pages. The Home URL can be specified in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor. The view can be set to follow links when they are tapped, and users can fill in Web forms. Warning: This is not a full browser. For example, pressing the phone's hardware Back key will exit the app, rather than move back in the browser history.

You can use the WebViewer.WebViewString property to communicate between your app and Javascript code running in the Webviewer page. In the app, you get and set WebViewString. In the WebViewer, you include Javascript that references the window.AppInventor object, using the methoods and setWebViewString(text).

For example, if the WebViewer opens to a page that contains the Javascript command
document.write("The answer is" + window.AppInventor.getWebViewString());
and if you set WebView.WebVewString to "hello", then the web page will show
The answer is hello.
And if the Web page contains Javascript that executes the command
window.AppInventor.setWebViewString("hello from Javascript"),
then the value of the WebViewString property will be
hello from Javascript.

blockProperties.name: CurrentPageTitle
blockProperties.description: Title of the page currently viewed

blockProperties.name: CurrentUrl
blockProperties.description: URL of the page currently viewed.   This could be different from the Home URL if new pages were visited by following links.

blockProperties.name: FollowLinks
blockProperties.description: Determines whether to follow links when they are tapped in the WebViewer.  If you follow links, you can use GoBack and GoForward to navigate the browser history.

blockProperties.name: HomeUrl
blockProperties.description: URL of the page the WebViewer should initially open to.  Setting this will load the page.

blockProperties.name: IgnoreSslErrors
blockProperties.description: Determine whether or not to ignore SSL errors. Set to true to ignore errors. Use this to accept self signed certificates from websites.

blockProperties.name: PromptforPermission
blockProperties.description: If True, then prompt the user of the WebView to give permission to access the geolocation API. If False, then assume permission is granted.

blockProperties.name: UsesLocation
blockProperties.description: Whether or not to give the application permission to use the Javascript geolocation API. This property is available only in the designer.

blockProperties.name: Visible
blockProperties.description: Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden.

blockProperties.name: WebViewString
blockProperties.description: Gets the WebView's String, which is viewable through Javascript in the WebView as the window.AppInventor object

methods.name: CanGoBack
methods.description: Returns true if the WebViewer can go back in the history list.

methods.name: CanGoForward
methods.description: Returns true if the WebViewer can go forward in the history list.

methods.name: ClearCaches
methods.description: Clear WebView caches.

methods.name: ClearLocations
methods.description: Clear stored location permissions.

methods.name: GoBack
methods.description: Go back to the previous page in the history list.  Does nothing if there is no previous page.

methods.name: GoForward
methods.description: Go forward to the next page in the history list.   Does nothing if there is no next page.

methods.name: GoHome
methods.description: Loads the home URL page.  This happens automatically when the home URL is changed.

methods.name: GoToUrl
methods.description: Load the page at the given URL.

name: YandexTranslate
helpString:
Use this component to translate words and sentences between different languages. This component needs Internet access, as it will request translations to the Yandex.Translate service. Specify the source and target language in the form source-target using two letter language codes. So"en-es" will translate from English to Spanish while "es-ru" will translate from Spanish to Russian. If you leave out the source language, the service will attempt to detect the source language. So providing just "es" will attempt to detect the source language and translate it to Spanish.

This component is powered by the Yandex translation service. See http://api.yandex.com/translate/ for more information, including the list of available languages and the meanings of the language codes and status codes.

Note: Translation happens asynchronously in the background. When the translation is complete, the "GotTranslation" event is triggered.

events.name: GotTranslation
events.description: Event triggered when the Yandex.Translate service returns the translated text. This event also provides a response code for error handling. If the responseCode is not 200, then something went wrong with the call, and the translation will not be available.

methods.name: RequestTranslation
methods.description:
By providing a target language to translate to (for instance, 'es' for Spanish, 'en' for English, or 'ru' for Russian), and a word or sentence to translate, this method will request a translation to the Yandex.Translate service.
Once the text is translated by the external service, the event GotTranslation will be executed.
Note: Yandex.Translate will attempt to detect the source language. You can also specify prepending it to the language translation. I.e., es-ru will specify Spanish to Russian translation.
